chapter.title: Change History
chapter.para:
This section provides information on updates made in the document over various versions.
Version
Description
6.0
This is the initial version of the document.

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This document describes the Fusion Corporate Channels front-end for users managing the parameters of the system at a bank middle-office and Bank Group sites. Such users are sometimes called bank administrators in this document, and should not be confused with the administrators of the system found at a client site.

Their main tasks are: maintenance of their fellow middle-office users, the definition and preparation of the system jurisdiction; and maintenance of the list of client companies. The administrator of a bank group is also in charge of the maintenance of the list of banks within the group.
All these features are available within a single menu in the same page. This page can be accessed by clicking System Features like on the home page.

note.para: The availability of the System Features menu and its functions is dependent on the permissions assigned to the user. Only those functions the user is authorised to use will be displayed.

chapter.para: The following System Features modules are available and covered in this manual:

listitem.para: Bank Maintenance (for the bank group administrator)

chapter.para: Only administrative tasks are described in this manual. They are not on the System Features page because they are are more closely related to the transactional aspects of Fusion Corporate Channels. Moreover the level of jurisdiction required does not have the same constraints as for the above modules. The related modules are:
In each chapter, an introduction provides an overview of the module followed by a detailed presentation of each option available in the module. An option generally corresponds to a sub-menu item.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: A Cash and Trade Portal system is used by two types of organisation: banks, and companies that are customers of banks. We refer to the latter as "customers" or "clients" - we use these two terms interchangeably.
In addition, we use the term "bank group" to mean a site with overriding authority over the system, such as a bank's head office.
A member of the staff of a client or bank is called a "user". A user with special administrator privileges is called an "administrator".
A Cash and Trade Portal system has two different user interfaces: for a user at a client, and for a user at a bank or bank group.

Both interfaces have a section called System Features, containing functions for administering and configuring the Cash and Trade Portal system. The rest of the interface contains end-user functions. Which functions are available to a given user depends on that user's privileges.
The document that a bank can provide, such as Letters of Credit, Standby Letters of Credit, Shipping Guarantees, and so on, are referred to as "products".

The communications between bank and client about an individual instance of a product typically consist of a sequences of messages. For example, the communications regarding a Letter of Credit would consist of the client's initial request, the bank's formal response, possibly some free-format messages containing further discussion, and possibly some further responses from the bank.

These individual messages are called "transactions" or "transaction events". Those sent by the bank in reply to a client message are called "reporting messages" (because the bank is "reporting back" - they should not be confused with reports produced using the Report Designer module). The whole set of messages concerning one instance of a individual product is called a "file" (this represents a "file of documents" and should not be confused with the files that can be uploaded containing details of a transaction)..

When a new file is created - for example, a client user creates a new Letter of Credit request - Fusion Corporate Channels gives it a unique reference number called its System Id. This is used throughout the system to identify it.

section.title: Audience
section.para: This manual is addressed to an administrator at a bank (including the bank group), and describes the administrator functions in the bank user interface.

section.title: Access Permissions and Administration
section.para: The System Features module is accessible for all logged-in bank users from the bank home page. However, different users see different features available, depending on their permissions. User permissions can be fully customised, but the following main categories of user can be highlighted:

listitem.para: All bank users are given access to the Change Profile module.
The bank administrator user is given access to the Change Profile and User Maintenance modules.
A customer administrator is given access to the Customer Maintenance module.
A bank group administrator is given access to the Bank Maintenance module.

section.para: When the bank (and bank group) is initially created, an administrator user is automatically created with the login bankadmin and password password, and granted the default permissions required to create and administer additional users.

section.title: Bank Group
section.para: In keeping with the multi-bank organisations promoted by the Global Cash and Trade Business Lines, a higher bank group level exists, that creates and manages various bank entities. Such bank group administrators are given access to the Bank Maintenance module, whereas this module does not appear in the System Features modules accessed by single bank institution (also called branches).

Fusion Corporate Channels also allows the bank group to manage cross-bank customers (also called international customers) that deal with multiple banks within the group. In such a configuration the bank group can also perform the usual middle-office Cash and Trade operations, as done by classic bank institution. The Bank Maintenance module is described in a dedicated chapter.

section.title: Roles
section.para: A Role defines a set of basic permissions (such as create LC, add user and so on) that are checked before the system gives the user access to the corresponding functionalities. Roles therefore define user profiles.

listitem.para: Specific Roles are set-up for the bank middle-office jurisdiction, and granted through the System Features to middle-office users, who consequently are granted the corresponding permissions. Roles are therefore the perfect way to set up a particular bank user profile, and are particularly useful to ease and simplify administration tasks.

But even more crucial, the bank specifies and sets up which roles its customer companies will be given access to. The roles are prepared by the bank to match the company jurisdiction organisation, and therefore simplify the customer administration tasks: indeed if the roles are correctly set up, a customer company will simply have to grant the relevant prepared roles to its Fusion Corporate Channels users. Well-defined roles also simplify and fasten the customer training. This ability to grant only a predefined set of roles to a company is an easy way to restrict which products the company has access to. For instance, it would be the preferred way to exclude the Shipping Guarantee product from the set of products that a customer can manage). In such an initial roles preparation phase, basic roles giving access to all Cash and Trade functionality can be defined, but fine grained roles can also be defined if required by the company, in order to match a more complex organisation.

section.para: The role preparation phase should be carefully handled and considered as part of the Fusion Corporate Channels parameterisation. Indeed once a panel of roles has been prepared, the creation of customer companies in the system becomes straight forward, merely consisting in granting the company access to the relevant roles. Note the system is initially delivered with a set of default roles that should cover most of the bank's needs.

section.title: Date and Amount Formats
section.para: When entering a date in a date field, two formats are available. You can enter it in the form DD/MM/YYYY or DDMMYY if your locale is for instance France, or in the form MM/DD/YYYY or MMDDYY if your locale is for instance the USA..

informalexample.para: For example, entering 180401 produces a display of 18/04/2001, which in a French locale corresponds to 18th April 2001.

section.para: When you enter an amount, the system automatically formats the value entered according to the currency selected. You can either enter the amount using the decimal and group delimiters of your locale (for example, respectively [,] and [space] for France, or [.] and [,] for Singapore), or directly as a series of digits.

informalexample.para: For example, 123456.00 in a Singaporean locale produces a display of 123,456.00 if the currency involved is associated with 2 decimal places.

section.title: Forward and Back Browser Buttons Behaviour
section.para: When you use a Browser's Forward and Back buttons, the browser's default behaviour is displayed and Fusion Corporate Channels doesn't provide any customised messages.

section.title: Browser to Operating System Compatibility Matrix
section.para: The matrix lists browser compatibility with various Operating Systems(OS).
T - Tested
S - Supported

section.title: Antivirus Scanning Service
section.para: This service provides an interface from Fusion Corporate Channels to an antivirus scanner of your company's choice. You can scan any attachment for viruses before uploading it from any transaction screen in Fusion Corporate Channels.

note.para: This service is enabled by the Fusion Corporate Channels Administrator.

section.title: Common Features
section.para: Many options, when selected, display a page that lists relevant records. These list pages have some things in common:

listitem.para: You can enter search criteria in a group of fields at the top of the page and click Search , to make the list show only records that match these criteria. These fields represent the most important fields in the record, as do the columns in the table.
You can use wildcards in these fields. The wildcard character is an asterisk (*). You can use it anywhere in a field.

On pages where the list might be very long - for example, if there are many transactions - the list is not displayed until you have entered the search criteria and clicked Search. In these cases, enter an asterisk in any of the search fields to get the entire list.
If a company has entities defined in its profile, then a column and a search criterion field for Entity appear in addition to the columns and fields mentioned in the individual descriptions below.
You can click the triangular icons in the heading of a column to sort the display on that column in ascending or descending order.
There may be a column where you can click to open the individual record for viewing or editing. These are described in the sections for the individual options.

section.title: Maker-Checker Functionality
section.para: Maker-Checker is a functionality where a transaction has to be approved by another user before it can be processed. The transaction created by a user (maker), has to be checked and approved by another user (checker) with required permissions. This functionality is permissions driven and users can be assigned either as a maker or a checker, or both. A user can also be assigned as a maker for one transaction and as a checker for another transaction. The maker can view details for all rejected transactions by using Audit Trail.

section.title: Maker-Checker Functionality - Bank Admin
section.para: The following is the list of system features functions where Maker-Checker is available for Bank Admins:

listitem.para: Entity: creation, modification and deletion.
Bank Authorisation Matrix: creation, modification, deletion
Customer Authorisation Matrix: creation, modification, deletion
Bank User Maintenance: creation, modification, deletion
Customer User Entities: assignment
Customer User Accounts Access: assignment
Reset Password

section.title: Maker-Checker Functionality - Bank Group Admin
section.para: The following is the list of system features functions where Maker-Checker is available for Bank Group Admins:

listitem.para: Roles: creation, modification, deletion
Customer Group: creation, modification, deletion
Customer User Maintenance: creation, modification, deletion
Bank User Maintenance: creation, modification, deletion
Reset Password

section.title: Maker-Checker Functionality - Workflow
section.para: The following is the maker-checker workflow:

listitem.para: For each function listed, the following additional columns are displayed for users with Checker permissions:
Status - The status is used to indicate the type of pending transaction for checker to validate (Add, Modify and Delete).
Maker User Id - The user Id of the creator of the transaction.

You can modify a transaction by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. If the checker feature for your user ID is enabled for a particular transaction, you can cancel a transaction by clicking on the Cancel
icon and review by clicking on the Approve or Reject or Return
icon. Clicking on the Approve or Reject or Return icon displays the Approve or Reject or Return form.

You can review the transaction details and use the buttons at the bottom of the page to process further. You can choose to approve, reject or return the transaction submitted by maker. Refer to the section on Action Buttons for information on button functions. You can enter your comments for returning a transaction in the Comments (for return) text box.

section.title: Approve or Reject or Return Form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a popup window will appear to confirm the choice.

row.entry: Return the transaction to the maker with comments. The transaction is displayed with the status 'Returned' to the maker, and the maker can correct it and submit it again to the checker for a review.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.

section.title: Overview
section.para: When a user connects to Fusion Corporate Channels, the home page includes a section showing items of news provided by the bank.

As the bank group administrator, you use the News Maintenance module to maintain this news service. It provides your bank's customers with updated news and analysis compiled by the bank's Trade Services team.

note.para: This module is available only to the Bank Group administrator.

section.title: Channels
section.para: A content provider or channel is a set of news items. There are internal channels, where you as bank group administrator create the news items yourself, and external channels, supplying news items from external aggregators.
Fusion Corporate Channels can maintain as many channels as the bank group needs, to distinguish different feeds of information for different audiences.

For instance, you could have different internal channels for different languages; or, you could have one internal channel that appears on every user's home page before log in, and others that appear when the user logs in.
When a company is created in Fusion Corporate Channels, one internal and one external channel is selected to be displayed to its users whenever they log in.
The list of content providers is set up by the technical administrator when installing Fusion Corporate Channels, by making entries in the appropriate properties file.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Each news item has three parts:

listitem.para: Topic

An image (typically a logo), showing what category the news item belongs to. The categories available are set up by the technical administrator when installing Fusion Corporate Channels. The topic is a link, which typically goes to an external website that is an overview appropriate to the category.
Title
A brief headline summarising the news item. This can optionally be a link, which would typically go to an external website giving background information on the news item.
Text
The text of the news item.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The News Maintenance functions are on their own menu, reached by clicking News Maintenance on the bank administrator's main menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Maintain news provided from within the bank

section.title: Internal News
section.para: This section describes the Internal News function and the forms it uses.

section.title: Internal News Options
section.para: This action has two sub-menu items, for maintaining internal news items.

section.title: View News Items
section.para: You can view and maintain existing news items. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing news channels (that is, internal content providers) currently defined on your Fusion Corporate Channels system.
The list of existing news channels has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the channel.

section.para: Click in the Channel Name column to get a list of all the news items currently visible on that channel.

The list of news items has the following elements. It is similar in appearance to the way the list appears on users' home pages, except that it has an extra column with action icons. It has no column headings - the field names given here refer to the terminology defined above.

entry.para: Image or logo, showing what category the news item belongs to. It is a link, typically to an external website that is an overview appropriate to the category.
Headline summarising the news item. It can be a link, typically to an external website giving background information on the news item.
(Below the title) Text of the news item.

section.para:
You can modify a news item by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. You can scroll up and down the list by clicking the up and down arrows in the right-hand column.

section.title: Add News Items
section.para: Add new news items.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing news channels (that is, content providers) currently defined on your Fusion Corporate Channels system.
The list of existing news channels has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the channel.

section.para: Click in the Channel Name column to get a form for adding a new news item to that channel.

section.title: Internal News Item Form
section.para: The Add News Item function, and the Edit action reached from the View News Item function, both display the same form; but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the news item. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

entry.para: Name of the topic (that is, category) that the news item belongs to. Select from the dropdown list. The content of the list, specifying the name and image for each topic, will have been set up by the technical administrator. You do not see the image itself in this form.
If either of the next two fields is filled in, this is a link, typically to background information on the news item. If both are blank this is not a link.
Web address (Uniform Resource Locator, URL) of the website that is to open when a user clicks on the title (see above) of the news item.
Text field and Browse button to attach a file from your local hard disk, which a user can download by clicking on the title (see above) of the news item.
This capability is only available to registered users. If an attachment is added to a news item in the default news channel, non-registered users will not be able to download the file.

Text area for the actual text of the news item. There are features for formatting, such as specifying font and colour, and inserting links and images. There is no limit on the amount of data you can enter, but keep in mind that a long text (more than 10 - 15 lines) will badly clutter the users' Home page, and should therefore be avoided.

chapter.title: System Features
chapter.para: A Bank Administrator is responsible for maintaining not only the processes and parameters required to manage client requests through the portal, but also the client definitions, roles and parameters that determine the way the clients use the portal and the functions available to them.

The System Features functions are used by Bank Administrators to maintain Bank and Client (Customer) details, accounts and parameters. This manual will cover both the Bank Administrator and Bank Group Administrator functions.

note.para: The availability of the System Features menu and its functions is dependent on the roles and permissions assigned to a user. Only those functions the user is authorised to use will be displayed. Contact your system administrator for any permissions related queries.

section.title: System Features Functions
section.para: The System Features menu is selected by clicking System Features from the navigation list on the bank Home page. This will display a menu of functions for selection on the left hand side of the page.
The following functions are available in the System Features navigation menu.

Change Profile
Change the administrators password and security questions.
Jurisdiction Maintenance
Customise the jurisdiction and authorisations used by the bank.
Rates Maintenance
As an administrator at a bank, you use this function to update the exchange rates used for currency conversions and in checking authorisation levels
Customer Maintenance
Maintain customer accounts and logins.
Bank Maintenance
This Bank Maintenance module is available to Bank Group administrators only. Only Bank Groups can create and manage subsidiary banks.
User Maintenance
Maintain Bank user logins.
Alerts Maintenance
Create and maintain alerts for bank notifications, milestones, and other events associated products supplied to customers.
Report Designer
Design and create tailored reports for use by users in the bank.
Parameter Maintenance
Maintain parameters used by the bank and customers in the Fusion Corporate Channels.
Guarantee Maintenance
Maintain Guarantee parameters used by the bank in the Fusion Corporate Channels.
Standby LC Maintenance
Maintain Standby LC parameters used by the bank in the Fusion Corporate Channels.
Facility Maintenance
As an administrator at a bank, you can add a credit facility that banks give their customers and allocate limits across the customer's various branches.
FSCM Program
Programs are created from the Bank side through TI or back office systems and can be viewed by corporate users in portal while raising invoices and requesting for financing.
Biller Maintenance
Maintain Billers defined to the Fusion Corporate Channels.
License Definition
As an administrator at a bank,you can add license definitions, which will be used by your client users.
CounterParty Maintenance
As an administrator at a bank, you can accept or reject new counterparty created by the customer.
Each of these functions are described in more detail in the following chapters.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This module has just one function on the System Features menu, called Change Profile. All users can use the Change Profile module to view and update their language and password. No particular jurisdiction is required to use this feature.
When you click this function, you are presented with a form to update your profile.

section.title: Change Profile - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Change Profile function, from the home page, select System Features, then select Change Profile from the side navigation menu. Alternatively, select the Manage Profile link from the top right of the banner.

section.title: Change Profile
section.para: When the Change Profile (or Manage Profile) function is selected, the Change User Profile page is displayed.

After entering your changes, click Save at the bottom of the form. When the password is changed, the password expiry date is computed and stored, and the invalid login attempts counter is reset. Depending on the system parameters, the new password may be checked against previously used passwords, and may be rejected. This prevents the same password from being used, and increases overall security.
The form is as follows:

entry.para: This is a reminder/summary of the user profile.
Your company's abbreviated name. This is part of the user identification in Fusion Corporate Channels.
Your first and last names. Up to 35 characters.
User language to be used in the Fusion Corporate Channels pages that you will access. Languages available with depend on your bank's preferences.
You use this section to change your password.

Put a tick here to show that you want to change your password. The following password fields are then mandatory.
The password policy, which defines the maximum and minimum length of the password, the characters accepted, and the combination of characters, is set up in the system by your administrator.

section.title: Change Profile - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a popup window will appear to confirm the choice.

row.entry:
Save the change profile action.
Remember to click Save when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made, has been clicked, and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.
Open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a bank, you use the Jurisdiction Maintenance module to define the roles used in Fusion Corporate Channels and the authorisation matrix used to release transactional reporting messages to the customers.

Jurisdiction defines the maximum amount of money that your users are authorised to submit a transaction for. You can assign combination of roles and permissions to your users, which allows them to perform transactions on permitted products and for a set amount. If a user does not have sufficient privileges for submitting a transaction, another user with the necessary privileges can submit the transaction.

For Banker's Guarantee transactions in trade, you can set the authorisation matrix for your users, permitting them to use products or sub products with the tenor and maximum amount limit configured. For example, you can set up the authorisation matrix for an Issued Banker's Guarantee (BG) for events such as New, Amend, or Message, for a specific amount and tenor (period). The following illustration is an example for a Banker's Guarantee authorisation matrix setup:
The authorisation matrix can be set up for issuance, amendment, message, and also if it is of multiple levels authorisation, can be sequential or non sequential.

For higher transaction amounts, or more hierarchical company organisations, the maximum amount can also be defined for a combination of two roles. In such a case the transaction must first be checked by a user with a controller profile (role 1), and then signed by a user with a sign profile (role 2). This authorisation jurisdiction system can therefore force a validation by two users as well as the input user (known as a six-eyes validation).

The authorisation amounts are expressed in the company's base currency. Whenever a transaction is submitted, a middle rate conversion is used to compare the transaction amount with these maximum authorisation amounts. The rates are fetched from the Fusion Corporate Channels's rate table.
As a reminder, two main categories of roles should be highlighted:

listitem.para: Some roles will be used internally within the bank, being granted only to the bank middle-office users.
Other roles will be made available to each client company; the company will in turn grant them to their users, according to the jurisdiction they want to set up.

note.para: A bank group may decide to set up all the roles later used by its banks and their client companies. Even though this approach may look restrictive, a standardisation of the roles is highly recommended, since it both speeds up the creation of user accounts and client companies in Fusion Corporate Channels, and simplifies the System Features tasks and understanding at the bank level.

section.title: Jurisdiction Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Jurisdiction Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Jurisdiction Maintenance from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Jurisdiction Maintenance - Options
section.para: The Jurisdiction Maintenance options are part of the System Features menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Assign local names to the roles created by the bank, in order to match your company's own naming conventions and facilitate further administration tasks. View and modify roles, a role being a set of basic permissions that can be grouped according to the various needs.
Define the properties of each role, overriding the properties defined for it by the bank. You can set limits to the amount that users with particular roles are allowed to process.

section.title: Jurisdiction Maintenance - Roles
section.para: This option allows a Bank Administrator to assign local names to the roles created by the bank.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the roles the company can use and their descriptions. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. You can use Reference, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page.

note.para: Only the Reference column is available if maker-checker functionality is not enabled.

section.para: The list of roles has the following columns:

entry.para: Role description, if already set up. This will be shown in the User Role Definition screens, and can be used to better describe/specify the meaning of a role.
If no description has been entered, the role name (shown in the Reference column) is used instead.
Shows whether the role can be granted to a bank group user, a bank user or a customer user.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can view a role by clicking the View
icon in the right-hand column. If you are a bank group administrator, you can edit it by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon (Special privileges are required to see the delete option). A last column is showing the various actions that can be undertaken in order to display, alter or delete each role record.
Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the role. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.

note.para: The role name uniquely identifies a role, so two roles cannot have the same name. Also take care that if a role is attributed to multiple banks, they will share it, and any role modification should therefore be handled with special care by the banks since it potentially affects all the related branches.

section.para: When a role is modified, all users granted this role will automatically get or lose the added or removed permissions the next time they log in. This is an interesting aspect of the use of roles and profiles: there is no need to update all users individually when a profile has to be amended.

section.title: Role form - Role Details
section.para: The following input fields are available:

entry.para: A reminder of the role name, non editable.

note.para: At the bank level, the role descriptions are never set, and therefore defaulted with the role name. Roles descriptions are indeed mostly useful in customer companies, in order to match the potential existing profile names.

section.title: Role form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a pop up window will appear to confirm the choice.

row.entry:
Save the role in draft state to edit at a later time.
For the role to take effect in the system, you'll have to submit it.
Save the new description for the role.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System features menu.
Open a pop up window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Jurisdiction Maintenance - Roles (Privileged Users)
section.para: Privileged users have a higher authority level compared to regular Bank Administrators, to allow them to perform more functions. For users with a higher Jurisdiction Maintenance privilege level, the following facilities are available.
Click the Add a new role button at the bottom of the list to add an authorisation. This button will not be available if you do not have the appropriate authority level.

Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the role. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.

note.para: The role name uniquely identifies a role, so two roles cannot have the same name. Also take care that if a role is attributed to multiple banks, they will share it, and any role modification should therefore be handled with special care by the banks since it potentially affects all the related branches.

section.para: When a role is modified, all users granted this role will automatically get or lose the added or removed permissions the next time they log in. This is an interesting aspect of the use of roles and profiles; there is no need to update all users individually when a profile has to be amended.

Type of role : the role can be a standard role, in which case it includes a set of permissions, or a role dedicated to the jurisdiction matrix (also called an Authorisation Level).

section.title: Jurisdiction Maintenance - Authorisation
section.para: You can define the properties for each role from this page. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the authorisations defined in the system. The following section describes the authorisation matrix.

When a transaction is received, a bank user is required to review, approve or reject, and process it. After selecting the appropriate options, and the Submit button is clicked, the Authorisation Matrix is checked for rules that apply to the transaction. The system will check product codes, types, authorisations levels and amounts defined in each rule, to see if the rule matches the transaction.

note.para: All rules will be checked, and if any that match the transaction (and the user privilege and authority levels) are satisfied, the transaction will be submitted and the transaction will be submitted and sent to the bank for processing. If no rules are satisfied, the transaction is placed in a "Pending Authorise" state until a authorised user attempts to submit it.

section.para: You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Product, Sub Product, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page.
Only Product and Sub Product columns are available if maker-checker functionality is not enabled. The list of authorisations has the following columns:

entry.para: Transaction type (*, Type, Amend, Message) that this authorisation applies to. Wildcard if it applies to all types.
Product code and sub product code that this authorisation applies to. Wildcard if this line applies to all products.

note.para: Sub product codes are available only for Banker's Guarantee.

entry.para: The sub type code for amending a Banker's Guarantee. The values are: Release and *.

note.para: This field is available when you select Amend from Type for Banker's Guarantee.

entry.para:
The type of product and the Tenor, if applicable.
Tenor type is displayed only for product Banker's Guarantee Issued.
The Account associated with the authorisation rule.
Indicates if a user with the 'Verify' permission must verify (submit) the transaction.
The authorization level(s) (A, B, C, or D) this rule applies to.
Only a user with the 'Send' permission can submit the transaction
Currency code for the maximum amount. This currency is the base currency of the company.

Maximum transaction amount that a user with this role is authorised to submit a transaction for. If a role 2 is given, then after a user with role 1 has prepared a transaction it must be approved by a person with role 2 before it can be sent.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

entry.para:
Add an authorisation.
The Transaction Type and Product can be wildcard's. In some configurations, the system may therefore get several lines matching the context of the current transaction. In order to decide which line should apply, a concept of best match is introduced whereby the definition of the Transaction Type has always the priority on the Product. .

Valid options are:* (All types) Banker's Guarantee Banker's Guarantee Received Bulk Order Credit Note Credit Note CR Export Collection Export Letter of Credit Factoring Financing Request Foreign Exchange Fund Transfer Import Collection Import Letter of Credit Import Open Account Invoice Invoice Payable Inward Remittance Issued Letter of Indemnity Issued Standby LC License Loan Purchase Order Purchase Order Apply Received Standby LC Secure Email Shipping Guarantee Term Deposit

listitem.para: Selecting any of the options starts the period of the application from 0 days. For example, selecting 'From 1 Year to 3 Year' means from 0 days to 3 years. Similarly, selecting 'From 3 Year to 5 Year' means from 0 days to 5 years.

Send indicates only a user with the 'Send' permission can submit the transaction, after the authorisation matrix has been applied.

If 'Sequential' is selected, when multiple authorisation levels are required for a transaction, they must be performed in the sequence defined under authorisation levels below. Otherwise, all levels must still authorise the transaction but they can be in any order.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a bank, you use the Rates Maintenance function to update the exchange rates used for currency conversions and in checking authorisation levels. Both Bank Group administrators and Bank Administrators can access this feature.

important.para: Your technical administrator can select the source of the foreign exchange (FX) rates from Treasury, Cash or Back-office (BO) and import the rates into the Fusion Corporate Channels database. This feature is known as Rates Download. The technical administrator has to set the following configuration in Fusion Corporate Channels to update rates from the incoming rates xml file from the BO:
important.programlisting:
#This line defines the bank's abbreviated name related to the middle office to # which the rate download is applicable. #The below configuration is left empty if the rates are to be maintained for the bank group. #The below configuration is updated with the respective bank's abbreviated name for # rate maintenance to be maintained at the bank level. # For example, if the rate is to be associated with the bank abbreviated name DEMOBANK, # the entry is as shown below. daemon.ti2mtpjmsinterfacedaemon.interface.banks = DEMOBANK
#This line defines the BO entity in the application. For example, Trade Innovation (TI) here. daemon.ti2mtpjmsinterfacedaemon.interface.backoffice = TI
#This line defines the property to select the appropriate FX rate source. #The valid values are: TREASURY, CASH or TI. exchange.rate.backoffice.source = TI
important.para: When the rates are downloaded from a BO system to Fusion Corporate Channels, by default, a Bank Group Administrator can login and view it. Fusion Corporate Channels updates the rates to the existing rate maintenance table rather than delete it and create a new table.

When currencies are downloaded from the BO source, the GTP_MASTER_CURRENCY table is updated. The currency is also assigned to the respective bank (referred to as the source bank in the property "daemon.ti2mtpjmsinterfacedaemon.interface.banks") in the GTP_BANK_CURRENCY table and mapped to the destination bank's abbreviated name. The destination bank details are available in the configuration of a parameter - P061 (Key_1 = <source bank> / '', Key_2 = '' / 'CCY' and DATA_1 = <destination bank>).

An entry for parameter P061 is required with respect to the bank's abbreviated name in the GTP_PARAM_DATA table, which determines the source bank's exchange rate and bank currency. The parameter P061 is derived by: KEY_1 = source bank (the bank where the exchange rate and currency is utilised), KEY_2 = '' / 'CCY' / 'XCH' (where 'CCY' denotes that it is for currency specifically, 'XCH' denotes that it is for exchange rate specifically and '' denotes that it for a combination of both), and DATA_1 = destination bank (bank from where the information is derived from). A base entry for KEY_1 = '', KEY_2 = '' and DATA_1 = '*' is required for the default setup, and any additional bank setup can be added to it.
A sample query is given below. For more details on P061 configuration, refer to the technical administration and technical reference guides.

section.para: You can also edit these rates in the Fusion Corporate Channels database, and the rates, edited or unedited, are applied to calculate the authorisation limits and credit limits across all modules. However, all transactions refer to the rates defined in the source and the rates in the Fusion Corporate Channels database have no effect on any of these transactions.
This module consists of one function on the System Features menu, called Rates.
When you click this function, you are presented with a list of all the existing rates. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Currency and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing rates has the following data columns:

row.entry:
Exchange rate versus the base currency (the base currency name is displayed in the column header).
If the currency is the base currency, the rate value is 1 and not editable,
If the currency parity is not 1 (100 for instance), the rate is given according to this parity,
If the currency is an EURO-IN currency, the rate is given against Euro (fixed euro rate).

section.para:
You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column.
You cannot add or delete a currency online. This can only be done by the technical administrator.

section.para:
When you click Edit

When a rate is modified, the new value is automatically used to check authorisations.

entry.para: ISO code of the base currency.
Full name of the base currency.

section.title: Customer Maintenance
section.para: As an administrator at a bank, you use the Customer Maintenance module to create, modify or delete customer companies in the system, to maintain definitions and parameters used by a company, and if required, to reset the main administrative user password of a customer company .

You can also specify which bank a customer can deal with, this feature being particularly useful in the context of a bank group managing international customers that deal with multiple banks (branches) within the group.

section.title: Customer Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Customer Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Customer Maintenance from the left navigation menu.

section.title: Customer Maintenance Options
section.para: After selecting System Features from the home page link, a number of options are provided for Customer Maintenance in the left navigation menu.The following is a list of the options:

listitem.para: Manage your bank's customer company accounts. You can create new accounts, update existing accounts, and delete existing accounts. When you create a new customer account, you are then shown a link to set up which banks the customer can deal with.

Manage a customer company's entities. These are business units or functional areas within the customers organisation. These entities will be available to the customer's administrator to manage the company's organization.
Display and maintain authorisation rule for customers.
Display and maintain User profiles for customers.
Manage customer user login and passwords.
Manage account product details linked to customers.
Manage BO Reference IDs linked to customer's reference.
Manage details of Beneficiaries lined to customers.
Upload details of beneficiaries in bulk using comma-separated value format.
Manage external accounts linked to customers.

note.para: You can use User Profile, User Permission, User Entities, User Authentication and Customer Matrix to carry out the same tasks for users at your bank's client companies that the companies' own administrators do by using the Profiles, Permissions, Entities, Authentication and Authorization functions on the client administrator interface.

section.title: Customer Maintenance - Profiles
section.para: Manage your bank's customer company accounts. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing customer company accounts for your bank. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name, Name, Statusand Actor fields at the top of the page.

note.para: Only the Abbreviated Name and Name fields are available if maker-checker functionality is not enabled.

section.para: The list of existing customer accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: You can enter or view the abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the company. This forms a part of the login details that a user at the company must enter to log into the Fusion Corporate Channels.
You can enter or view the name of the company.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

You can modify an account by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

note.para: If your bank did not create the client itself (the bank group created it), you can't delete or modify the record.

section.para: When you delete a company, its account and all its user accounts (including the administrator user) are deleted from the system. However, all transaction data is kept in the system for historical and inquiry purposes. They should be purged separately from the transaction functions.
Click the Add a new account button at the bottom of the list to add an account.

Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the user's account. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.

This user is granted the default role sy_admin_user, enabling him or her to add and manage additional users in the company.
When the Dual Control (enabled) option is not selected, the company is created without any users. The initial administrator can later on be activated through the Authentication feature.

section.title: Profiles Form - System Settings
section.para:
The following table provides details for this section:
Field
Type
Description
Authorise Own Transaction
You can select this option to enable users authorise their own transactions.
By default, this option is not selected, and any transaction will require authorisation by a user assigned with the appropriate role-permissions.
Bulk Authorise Limit at Payment
If you select this option, the system will check if the highest transaction amount of the bulk payment is within the set authorisation limit. If the amount exceeds the limit, the transaction will not be processed.
By default, this option is not selected, and the system will check whether the total amount of the bulk payments is within the set authorisation limit. If the total amount exceeds the limit, the transactions will not proceed.
Auto Forward Date
You can select this option to set auto forward of transaction processing dates. Transactions can be auto forwarded if the cut-off time is exceeded or if the transaction processing date is a holiday.
By default, this option is not selected. If it is in the not-selected state, you may have to amend the transaction processing date (if you created the transaction) or move the transaction to draft for amendment (if you are required to authorise the transaction).
File Upload Settings
This subsection provides setting details for processing bulk upload of transactions from files.
The settings described here are applicable only for the client's File Upload screen in Cash Services. These settings are not applicable for file upload features on other screens in the application.
Check File Hash Value
You can select this option if you want the system to check for hash values when files are uploaded. Any difference in the values in the file and the expected hash values will reject the file upload and generate an error log.
By default, this option is not selected.
Check Duplicate Files (MD5)
You can select this option if you want the system to check and compare for MD5 hash values between the file being uploaded and the file previously uploaded during the same calendar day (12AM to 12PM period). If the files share the same MD5 hash value, the system will reject the upload and display a message that the file cannot be uploaded.
By default, this option is not selected.
Check Duplicate Customer Reference
You can select this option if you want the system to check bulk upload of transactions against the database for duplicate customer references. Any duplicate records found in the file will be treated according to whether the file type is amendable or non-amendable.
By default, this option is not selected, and in this state, the system will not check for any duplicate references and upload the transactions.
File Upload Encryption Method
You can specify the encryption method to be used when uploading files.
Non - Amendable File Types
You can select the action to take for errors encountered in non-amendable files. The following options are available:
Reject whole file if any error Process successful transactions and reject errors
Merge/de-merge/delete allowed
You can select this option if you want the system to merge, de-merge or delete transactions from bulk upload files. This applies only to non-amendable file types.
By default, this option is not selected.
Transactions from amendable file type cannot be merged/de-merged/deleted.
Amendable File Types
You can select the action to take for errors encountered in amendable files. You can use 'All bulks to draft if any error' to save as draft and repair the file. You can use 'Bulk successful and transaction with error separately' to process successful entries, and save any entries with errors as draft and repair the file.
All bulks to draft if any error Bulk successful and transaction with error separately

Lists all the governing structures of an agreement that are available, possible values are Sweep, Hybrid and Flexible.
List of Currencies
Lists the currencies that are available for the liquidity enabled customer
Type of Execution
Lists the Type of Execution that are available for the liquidity enabled customer, possible values are OnDemand, Simulation and Event Based.
Type of Trigger Event
Lists the Type of Trigger Event that are available for the liquidity enabled customer, possible values are Balance and Activity.
Account Types
Lists the required account types supported by the liquidity enabled customer, possible values are Current and Savings.
Entity Type
Lists the Entity Type that are available for the liquidity enabled customer, possible values are Single Entity or Multi Entity
Multibank Supported
States whether Multibank is supported by the liquidity enabled customer
Inter Account Tracking
States whether Inter Account Tracking is supported by the liquidity enabled customer
Non Live Structure
States whether Non Live Structure is supported by the liquidity enabled customer
Cross Border Supported
States whether Cross Border is supported by the liquidity enabled customer
Multi-Currency Supported
States whether Multi-Currency is supported by the liquidity enabled customer
Sweep Back
States whether Sweep Back is supported by the liquidity enabled customer

section.title: Customer Maintenance - Customer Entities
section.para: Manage your bank's customer Entities. Entities are Business or functional groups within the customers company.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing customer company accounts for your bank. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing customer accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the company. This is part of the login data that a user at the company must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para: Unlike most functions in Fusion Corporate Channels, this function has a second level of list. When you click in the Abbreviated Name column, you are presented with a list of the selected company's entities. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity ID, Name, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page.

note.para: Only the Entity ID and Name fields are available if maker-checker functionality is not enabled.

section.para: When the bank administrator selects this option, a list of all the existing customer company (for example, accounts) recorded in the system is returned under the form of a searchable and sortable list of items. The data available for the search pattern includes the unique company as well as its Name. Wildcard's can be used to filter out more selectively the records returned.
The list of the company's entities has the following columns:

entry.para: The defined name of the Entity.
The legal ID number of the Entity.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can modify an Entity by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
If your bank did not create the Entity itself (the bank group created it), you can't delete or modify the record.

When you delete an Entity, its account and all its user accounts (including the administrator user) are deleted from the system. However, all transaction data is kept in the system for historical and inquiry purposes. They should be purged separately from the transaction functions.
Click the Add a new entity button at the bottom of the list to add an account.
Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the Customer Entity. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

Y shows that the account is active and N shows that it is inactive.

section.title: Entities Form - System Settings
section.para:
This section contains the System settings for this entity:
Field
Type
Description
Authorise Own Transaction
You can select this option to enable users authorise their own transactions.
By default, this option is not selected, and any transaction will require authorisation by a user assigned with the appropriate role-permissions.
Bulk Authorise Limit at Payment
If you select this option, the system will check if the highest transaction amount of the bulk payment is within the set authorisation limit. If the amount exceeds the limit, the transaction will not be processed.
By default, this option is not selected, and the system will check whether the total amount of the bulk payments is within the set authorisation limit. If the total amount exceeds the limit, the transactions will not proceed.
Auto Forward Date
You can select this option to set auto forward of transaction processing dates. Transactions can be auto forwarded if the cut-off time is exceeded or if the transaction processing date is a holiday.
By default, this option is not selected. If it is in the not-selected state, you may have to amend the transaction processing date (if you created the transaction) or move the transaction to draft for amendment (if you are required to authorise the transaction).
File Upload Settings
This subsection provides setting details for processing bulk upload of transactions from files.
Check File Hash Value
You can select this option if you want the system to check for hash values when files are uploaded. Any difference in the values in the file and the expected hash values will reject the file upload and generate an error log.
By default, this option is not selected.
Check Duplicate Files (MD5)
You can select this option if you want the system to check and compare for MD5 hash values between the file being uploaded and the file previously uploaded during the same calendar day (12AM to 12PM period). If the files share the same MD5 hash value, the system will reject the upload and display a message that the file cannot be uploaded.
By default, this option is not selected.
Check Duplicate Customer Reference
You can select this option if you want the system to check bulk upload of transactions against the database for duplicate customer references. Any duplicate records found in the file will be treated according to whether the file type is amendable or non-amendable.
By default, this option is not selected, and in this state, the system will not check for any duplicate references and upload the transactions.
File Upload Encryption Method
You can specify the encryption method to be used when uploading files.
Non - Amendable File Types
You can select the action to take for errors encountered in non-amendable files. The following options are available:
Reject whole file if any error Process successful transactions and reject errors
Merge/de-merge/delete allowed
You can select this option if you want the system to merge, de-merge or delete transactions from bulk upload files. This applies only to non-amendable file types.
By default, this option is not selected.
Transactions from amendable file type can be merged/de-merged/deleted.
Amendable File Types
You can select the action to take for errors encountered in amendable files. You can use 'All bulks to draft if any error' to save as draft and repair the file. You can use 'Bulk successful and transaction with error separately' to process successful entries, and save any entries with errors as draft and repair the file.
All bulks to draft if any error Bulk successful and transaction with error separately

section.title: Customer Maintenance - Authorisation
section.para: This section allows Bank Group Administrators and Bank Administrators to view and maintain Authorisation rules for customers. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing customer accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the company. This is part of the login data that a user at the company must enter to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para: Unlike most functions in Fusion Corporate Channels, this function has a second level of list. When you click in the Abbreviated Name column, you are presented with a list of the selected company's Authorisation rules. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity, Type, Product, Sub Product, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page. Wildcard's can be used to filter out more selectively the records returned.

note.para: Only the Entity, Type, Product, and Sub Product fields are available if maker-checker functionality is not enabled.

section.para: When the bank administrator selects this option, a list of all the existing customer Authorisation rules in the system is returned under the form of a searchable and sortable list of items.
The list of the company's Authorisations has the following columns:

note.para: This field is not available if you have not added a customer's entity. Refer to the topic Customer Maintenance - Customer Entities for more information.

entry.para: Transaction type (New, Amend, Message) that this authorisation applies to. Wildcard if it applies to all types.
Product code that this authorisation applies to. Wildcard if this line applies to all products.
The Type of product, if applicable
Account the authorisation is associated with.
A user with the 'Verify' permission must verify (submit) the transaction before the authorisation matrix is applied.
The authorization level(s) (A, B, C, or D) this authorisation applies to.
Send indicates only a user with the 'Send' permission can submit the transaction, after the authorisation matrix has been applied.
Currency code for the maximum amount. This currency is the base currency of the company.

Maximum transaction amount that a user with this role is authorised to submit a transaction for. If a role 2 is given, then after a user with role 1 has prepared a transaction it must be approved by a person with role 2 before it can be sent.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can modify an Entity by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Bank administrators cannot edit or delete authorisations created by a client administrator.
If maker-checker functionality is enabled, then the Action
icon is displayed to the Checker if the authorisation is awaiting approval. And for Authorisations awaiting approval, the Cancel
icon is displayed to the Maker, which provides the Maker the option to cancel the Authorisation by clicking this button before approval.
Click the Add a new Authorisation button at the bottom of the list to add a new authorisation line.

section.title: Authorisation Form
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank (except that the Currency is set to your company's base currency and the Type and Product fields are set to wildcard) and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the authorisation. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

entry.para:
Select the entity required for the authorisation. Click the Search Entity
icon and a popup with the list of entities appears. If required, enter values for abbreviated name or name and click on the Search button to refine the list. Use wildcards (*) to view all entries. Click on the required entity from the list and it appears in the Entity field.

note.para: This field is not available if you have not added a customer's entity. Refer to the topic Customer Maintenance - Customer Entities for more information.

entry.para: Transaction type that this authorisation is to apply to. Select from the dropdown list: New, Amend, or Message. Wildcard if it applies to all types.

Product that this authorisation is to apply to. Select from the dropdown list. Wildcard if it applies to all types. Valid options are:* - All types Fund Transfer Export Collection Financing Request Inward Remittance Invoice Payable Term Deposit Invoice Import Collection Import Letter of Credit Received Standby LC Purchase Order Apply Purchase Order Advise Issued Standby LC Banker's Guarantee Received Shipping Guarantee Secure Email Bulk Order Export Letter of Credit Banker's Guarantee
The Type of product, if applicable

Select the account linked to the authorisation. Click the Search Account
icon and a popup with the list of accounts appears. If required, enter values for account number, or select a currency (Ccy), or enter description, or use a combination of the fields, and click on the Search button to refine the list. Use wildcards (*) to view all entries. Click on the required account from the list and it appears in the Account field.
The Currency code and maximum amount authorised for the specified combination of type, product. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid currency codes.
Click this box if a user with the 'Verify' permission must verify (submit) the transaction before the authorisation matrix is applied.
Send indicates only a user with the 'Send' permission can submit the transaction, after the authorisation matrix has been applied.

If multiple authorisation levels are required for a transaction, they must be performed in the sequence defined under authorisation levels below. If 'Sequential' is selected, each level must be authorised in order.

row.entry:
This section defines the Authorisation levels that must be applied to the transaction before it can be submitted. A user assigned to each individual level must review and authorise (submit) the transaction before it will be sent to the bank.
You can modify the authorisation levels for existing items by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

entry.para: Click this button to select additional levels required to authorise a transaction.
Select the authorisation level that must be applied to the transaction before it can be sent.

section.para:
The Main Details section of the form is as follows:
Field
Type
Description
Company
Reminder of the company's abbreviated name that is part of the user identification in Fusion Corporate Channels.

Login Id that the user will use to log into Fusion Corporate Channels. This identifies the user uniquely within the company. Maximum of 32 characters.
Password
(Present only for Add.) Default password for the user.
The password policy, which defines the maximum and minimum length of the password, the characters accepted, and the combination of characters, is set up in the system by your administrator.
This field is not displayed if the auto-password generation feature is enabled for your Bank.

(Present only for Add.) Retype the default password.

Id No

(line 1)
Address of the user.
You can enter up to 5 lines of 35 characters each.
Post Code
Post code of the user.
You can enter a maximum of 16 characters in this field.

Select from the dropdown list: Inactive or Active. This is useful to temporarily inactivate and disable the user's access to Fusion Corporate Channels.

Select from the dropdown list: Password or No Re-Authentication. Select Password to enable users to enter their password and re-authenticate for any transactions in their account. For example, fund transfers, add a beneficiary and so on. Select No Re-Authentication to enable users to continue with their transactions without providing an additional authentication.

This field is not displayed if the auto-password generation feature is enabled for your Bank.
After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form. The changes take effect the next time the user logs in to Fusion Corporate Channels.
When the password is changed, the password expiry date is computed and stored, and the counter of invalid login attempts is reset. The user is also re-activated if previously inactive.

section.title: Authentication Form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a pop up window will appear to confirm the choice.

row.entry: Save the new authentication in draft status.

Save the new password. The changes take effect the next time the user logs into Fusion Corporate Channels. When the password is changed, the password expiry date is computed and stored, and the counter of invalid login attempts is reset. The user is also re-activated if previously inactive.
The submit action displays the password on a popup if the Bank is configured for a combination of the auto-password generation and display the auto-generated password feature. If Maker-Checker is enabled for your Bank, you'll need to have Checker privileges to Submit and to view the password.

section.title: Customer Maintenance - User Accounts
section.para: This option is used to link bank accounts to customer user profiles, for their use. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing customer company accounts for your bank. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing customer accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the company. This is part of the login data that a user at the company must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para: Unlike most functions in Fusion Corporate Channels, this function has a second level of list. When you click in the Abbreviated Name column, you are presented with a list of the selected company's Users. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page. Wildcard's can be used to filter out more selectively the records returned.

note.para: The Status and Maker User fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: When the bank administrator selects this option, a list of all the existing customer User IDs in the system is returned under the form of a searchable and sortable list of items.

entry.para: First Name and Last Name of the user.
Login Id used by the user to log into Fusion Corporate Channels. This login Id uniquely identifies a user account within the company.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

icon in the right-hand column.
You cannot add or delete users via this list - you can only add or delete users by using the Profiles function. For more details, see Customer Maintenance - User Profiles.

section.title: Customer Maintenance - Beneficiary File Upload
section.para: This option is used to upload a set of beneficiaries using a .TXT or .CSV file in comma-separated value format. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all beneficiary file uploads for your bank and the statuses of the uploads.You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing customer accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the company. This is part of the login data that a user at the company must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para: Unlike most functions in Fusion Corporate Channels, this function has a second level of list. When you click in the Abbreviated Name column, you are presented with a list of the selected company's beneficiary file uploads. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity, Date, Product Type, File Status, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page. Wildcard's can be used to filter out more selectively the records returned.

note.para: The Status and Maker User fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: When the bank administrator selects this option, a list of all the beneficiary uploads in the system is returned under the form of a searchable and sortable list of items.

entry.para: Entity within your company that is linked to the beneficiary.

note.para: This column is displayed if your company has the Entity feature enabled.

entry.para: Name of the Bank chosen by the customer. If the Product Type is MT 103 Telegraphic Transfer, this column displays the asterisk (*) symbol.

note.para: This column is displayed if your company has the Multi-bank feature enabled.

row.entry: Select the date range (From and To) for the search.

entry.para: Status of the beneficiary file upload. The information indicates whether the upload was pendng, in process, successful, partially successful or a failure.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: Click the Upload New File button at the bottom of the list to upload beneficiary details.

You can view the details for the file uploads by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. The log presents sections for General Details, File Details and Uploaded File Results. The section for File Details displays the number of records uploaded and a link to view the uploaded file. The Uploaded File Results section displays details for the number of new beneficiaries, number of modified beneficiaries and number of failed beneficiaries.

section.title: Beneficiary File Upload Form - General Details
section.para: Click the Upload New File button to display the Add Customer Beneficiary File Upload form. This form has sections for General Details and File Upload Details. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form. The beneficiary details will be uploaded into the system.
The form is as follows:

row.entry: Add description and product category in this section.

entry.para: Enter a description or name for the beneficiary file upload.
This field defines the Product Type of the beneficiary and determines the beneficiary details required. Select a product type from the dropdown list, as shown below. (Mandatory)

Cashier's Order/Demand Draft Third Party Transfer MT 103 Telegraphic Transfer Domestic Transfer India Domestic TransferDifferent input fields will be required based on the selection made. For details on the input fields required, refer to specific product types information in further subsections. For example, refer to subsection 'Cashier's Order/Demand Draft - Beneficiary File Upload Details' for product type Cashier's Order/Demand Draft.

row.entry: Add a file from here. The information for the maximum number of files that can be uploaded is displayed here. The rows in this section display details for Title and File Name of uploaded files.

entry.para: Click this button to download the file to the local system. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
Click this button to delete the uploaded file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

row.entry: Click this button to open the File Details popup. Enter the title for the file upload and browse to the location of the file, and select the file to upload.

section.title: Cashier's Order/Demand Draft - Beneficiary File Upload Details
section.para: When the product selected is Cashier's Order/Demand Draft, the details for the following fields must be available in the file upload.

entry.para: Enter the name of the entity within your company that is linked to the beneficiary. This field is applicable if your company has the Entity feature enabled. This field is optional.

note.para: You can keep the entity column blank or enter an abbreviated name. If it is kept blank, the system considers it as '*'.

entry.para: Enter the name of the customer's bank in the column customer_bank. This field is applicable if your company has the Multi-bank feature enabled. This field is optional.

note.para: You can keep the customer_bank column blank or enter an abbreviated name. If it is kept blank, the system considers it as '*'.

entry.para: Enter 'Y' to denote that the beneficiary is active or 'N' to denote not active in the column active_flag. This field is optional.
Enter the name of the first counterparty in the column counterparty_name. This field is mandatory.
Enter the name of the second counterparty in the column counterparty_name_2. This field is optional.
Enter the name of the third counterparty in the column counterparty_name_3. This field is optional and applicable only for Cashier's Order.
Enter the first line of the beneficiary's address in the column address_line_1. This field is mandatory.
Enter the first line of the beneficiary's address in the column address_line_2. This field is optional.
Enter the first line of the beneficiary's address in the column address_line_3. This field is optional.
Enter additional lines of beneficiary's address in the column dom. This field is optional.

note.para: DOM doesn't require bank name and branch name as these values are referred from the valid bank and branch codes provided through the file upload.

entry.para: Enter the beneficiary's country code in the column bene_details_country. This field is optional.
Enter the beneficiary's Postal Code in the column bene_details_postal_code. This field is optional.
Enter 'Y' to denote that the beneficiary is pre-approved for finance or 'N' to denote not pre-approved in the column pre_approved. This field is optional.
Enter the threshold amount currency for pre-approved payments in the column threshold_cur_code. This field is optional.
Enter the threshold amount for pre-approved payments in the column threshold_amt. This field is optional.
Enter the Beneficiary ID in the column beneficiary_id. This field is mandatory.
Enter the payee reference details in the column payee_ref. This field is optional.
Enter the customer reference details in the column cust_ref. This field is optional.
Enter the primary E-mail address of the beneficiary in the column email_1. This field is optional.
Enter the secondary E-mail address of the beneficiary in the column email_2. This field is optional.
Enter the beneficiary's fax number in the column fax. This field is optional.
Enter the beneficiary's phone number in the column phone. This field is optional.
