section.title: Overview
section.para: This Bank Maintenance module is available to Bank Group administrators only. Only Bank Groups can create and manage subsidiary banks.

Fusion Corporate Channels is initially delivered and set up with a single Bank Group and its bank administrator (the bankadmin user). Starting from this Bank Group, it is then possible to define all necessary banks. They will in turn be responsible for creating their own customer companies.

As the bank group administrator, you use this Bank Maintenance module to create, modify or delete subsidiary banks in the system, to define the default roles these banks are allowed to use, and if required, to reset the passwords of bank administrators.
Subsidiary banks are often called branches. Where it does not cause ambiguity, they are often called simply banks. We use these three terms interchangeably throughout this chapter.

section.title: Bank Maintenance Options
section.para: The Bank Maintenance options are part of the System Features menu. Click on System Features from the home page and then click on Bank Alerts from the left menu. The following options are available:

listitem.para: Manage your subsidiary banks. You can create new branches, update existing branches, and delete existing branches. When you create a new branch, a default bankadmin user is also created, and granted all required permissions to manage the bank. When you create a new branch, you are then shown a link to set up the roles that the branch will by default have access to.

Manage a branch's permissions. This basically consists of selecting a set of roles the branch will be initially allowed to use. Note that this is merely a default set-up, since the branches will be most likely authorised to set up roles themselves. Nevertheless, this Role preparation at the Bank Group level can simplify and standardise the Role definitions among the Group.
Manage a bank's alerts configurations. You can add required alerts to the bank using this function.
Reset the main administrator password of a subsidiary bank.
Reset the main administrator password of a subsidiary bank.

section.para: If you are the Bank Group administrator, you have several further functions under Bank Maintenance, as follows.

You use User Profile, User Permission, User Authentication, Bank Matrix and Bank Alerts to carry out the same tasks for users at the subsidiary banks in your group as you do for users in your own bank by using the Profiles, Permissions and Authentication functions under User Maintenance, the Authorisation function under Jurisdiction Maintenance, and the Submission function under Alerts. See the User Maintenance, Jurisdiction Maintenance, and Alerts chapters for details.

section.title: Bank Maintenance - Profiles
section.para: Manage your subsidiary banks.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing branches for your Bank Group. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing branches has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the branch. This is part of the login data that a user at the branch must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para:
You can modify the details of the branch by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

A branch can be deleted only once. When you delete a branch, a security check is performed to make sure that all its customers have already been deleted. If thy have, then the branch and all its user accounts (including the bankadmin user) are deleted from the system.
Click the Add a new account button at the bottom of the list to add an branch.

Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the branch. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the branch. This is part of the login data that a user at the branch must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels. Maximum of 35 characters.
Name of the branch. The default length of this field is 35, configurable upto 200 characters based on the property "maximum.allowed.company.name".
SWIFT Address details of the bank user
Address of this branch. Up to 3 lines of 35 characters each.

(Optional) Reference ID that associates a bank with a branch in the treasury back office. Select the Treasury Branch Reference (Treasury branch and branch name) from the dropdown list. You must select the Treasury Branch Reference when you set up a bank profile to allow the treasury transactions related to a branch to be routed to the respective treasury branch. Alphanumeric, maximum of 2 characters. Displayed only if the branch is available.
Postal Address details of the bank user
The street name (and Number) for the Customer's Postal Address.
Customer's Post code. Maximum of 16 characters.
Customer's country code. Maximum of 2 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of Country Codes.
Additional Reference for the bank. Up to 34 characters.

(Optional) Reference ID that associates a bank with a branch in the treasury back office. Select the Treasury Branch Reference (Treasury branch and branch name) from the dropdown list. You must select the Treasury Branch Reference when you set up a bank profile to allow the treasury transactions related to a branch to be routed to the respective treasury branch. Alphanumeric, maximum of 2 characters. Displayed only if the branch is available.

Select the applicable Liquidity Financial Institution from the dropdown.
This field is available on portal only when liqidity.back.office.ktp is set to 'False'.
Time zone area for the Bank.

Bank language, driving the Fusion Corporate Channels pages language that the bank middle-office users will access. This language is also used to define the date and number format presented by default to the bank users.
Base currency code of the bank (three alphabetic characters). This currency is defaulted to the currency of the bank group. Click the magnifying glass icon to select the currency code.
(Optional) Name of usual contact within the branch. Maximum of 35 characters.

section.title: Bank Maintenance - Permissions

section.para: Manage a branch's permissions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing branches for your Bank Group. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing branches has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the branch. This is part of the login data that a user at the branch must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para:
You can modify a branch's permissions by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or view them in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon.
You cannot add or delete branches via this list - you can only add or delete branches by using the Profiles function.

When you click the Edit
icon, you get the following form.

listitem.para: This is a default set-up, since the subsidiary banks will be most likely authorised to set up roles themselves.
Among the roles granted to a branch, you should include the roles that the branch is in turn allowed to give to its own customers. You should remember this when creating the subsidiary banks

section.para: The fields in this form are described in the following sections.

entry.para: Unique string of characters that identifies the bank in Fusion Corporate Channels (it also part of the bank's user identification through the login screen of Fusion Corporate Channels).
Up to 3 lines of 35 characters each for the address of this bank.
Name of usual contact within the branch.

section.title: Permissions Form - Roles for Bank Users
section.para: This section defines the roles the bank will be allowed to grant to its users.
The bank's administrator will have these roles available when creating the bank users' profiles.

entry.para: Shows the list of roles currently granted to the bank for its users.
Show the list of remaining roles that could be granted to the bank.
Grant the roles selected in the list of available roles (Upper Section) to the bank.
The selected roles will then be moved to the list of roles granted to the bank (lower Section).
Remove the roles selected in the list of roles currently granted to the bank (Lower Section).
The selected roles will then be moved back to the list of available roles (Upper Section).

section.title: Permissions Form - Roles for Customers Users
section.para: This section defines the roles the bank will be allowed to grant to its customer companies.
The bank administrator will have these roles available when assigning the roles to be made available to a customer.

entry.para: Shows the list of roles currently granted to the customer for its users.
Show the list of remaining roles that could be granted to the customer.
Grant the roles selected in the list of available roles (Upper Section) to the customer.
The selected roles will then be moved to the list of roles granted to the customer (lower Section).
Remove the roles selected in the list of roles currently granted to the customer (Lower Section).
The selected roles will then be moved back to the list of available customer (Upper Section).

section.title: Permissions Form - Entity Roles
section.para: This section defines the roles the bank will be allowed to grant to its customer's entities.
The bank administrator will have these roles available when assigning the roles to be made available to a customer.

entry.para: Shows the list of roles currently granted to the customer for its Entities.
Show the list of remaining roles that could be granted to the customer.
Grant the roles selected in the list of available roles (Upper Section) to the customer for its Entities.
The selected roles will then be moved to the list of roles granted to the customer for its Entities (lower Section).
Remove the roles selected in the list of roles currently granted to the customer for its Entities (Lower Section).
The selected roles will then be moved back to the list of available customer for its Entities (Upper Section).

section.para: After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

note.para: Whenever the bank permissions are saved, the list of authorisation levels (users are granted an authorisation level that defines the maximum transaction amount they can release) made available to the bank is updated with the newest authorisation levels that may have been added in the system.

section.title: Bank Maintenance - Bank Alerts
section.para: This section allows the Bank Group Administrator to view and maintain Alerts for Banks.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing alerts for your bank. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.

section.para: Unlike most functions in Fusion Corporate Channels, this function has a second level of list. When you click in the Abbreviated Name column, you are presented with a list of the selected company's alerts. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page. Wildcard's can be used to filter out more selectively the records returned.
When the bank group administrator selects this option, a list of all the existing Bank Alerts in the system is returned under the form of a searchable and sortable list of items.
The list of the Alerts has the following columns:

entry.para: Products for which the alert is to be sent.
Sub product for the selected product.
Transaction types for which the alert is to be sent.
Status of the product transaction when an alert is to be sent.
Currency and amount greater than or less than conditions that will trigger an alert.
The person that should receive the alert.

section.para:
You can modify a login by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add Alert button at the bottom of the list to add a new alert.

Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the alerts configuration. Correspondence Language and Email Address fields appear on selecting Custom Recipient. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

section.title: Add Alert Form
section.para: When you select this option, you are presented with the following sub form. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

note.para: Click Save when you have made your changes. If you simply navigate away from the page, your changes will be lost, even though you have clicked OK on the sub-form(s) where you made the changes and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Products for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list. Select wildcard to mean all products.
Sub Products of the selected Product, for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list. Select wildcard to mean all sub products.
Transaction types for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list.: New, Amend, Message, Reporting. Select wildcard to mean all types.
The current status of the product for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list (for example, Rejected, Pending, New, and so on.). Select wildcard to mean all statuses.
Customer for which the alert is to be sent. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from a list of valid customers. Mandatory field if present. Select wildcard to mean all companies.
Select : Less Than, or Greater Than, and the currency and amount to determine the conditions under which an alert should be sent. Select asterisk if you want to send an alert regardless of the amount
Select the recipient to receive the alert. Options are:Input User Control User Release User Custom Recipient - (When selected, Language / Locale and Email Address fields are made available)
Select the Recipient Language from the dropdown menu. Only available if Recipient is selected as Custom Recipient.
Email address of the Recipient. Only available if Recipient is selected as Custom Recipient.
Click to add the new alert to the list.
Click to abandon creating the alert, and close the sub-form.

section.title: Bank Maintenance - Authentication

note.para: Access to this module must be given with care, and only to the password administrator.

section.para: Reset the main administrator password of a branch.

This is especially useful whenever a bank administrator has forgotten his or her password. It is also used to activate the initial administrator user if this was not created when the branch was created on the system.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing branches for your Bank Group. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing branches has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the branch. This is part of the login data that a user at the branch must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.para: Unlike most functions in Fusion Corporate Channels, this function has a second level of list. When you click in the Abbreviated Name column, you are presented with a list of the selected bank's users. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page. Wildcard's can be used to filter out more selectively the records returned.
When the bank group administrator selects this option, a list of all the existing Bank Users in the system is returned under the form of a searchable and sortable list of items.
The list of the Bank's Users has the following columns:

entry.para: First Name and Last Name of the user.
Login Id used by the user to log into Fusion Corporate Channels. This login Id uniquely identifies a user account within the Bank.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a bank, you use the User Maintenance module to create, modify or delete user accounts at your bank, define the permissions granted to those users, and reset user passwords.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The term "account" is used in the sense it is normally used in software, to mean a user's registration with a system enabling him or her to log in - not in the everyday banking sense of a place to keep money.

section.title: User Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the User Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select User Maintenance from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: User Maintenance Options
section.para: The User Maintenance options are part of the System Features menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Maintain bank user accounts. A user's account details are called his or her profile. You can create new accounts, update existing accounts, and delete existing accounts. You cannot delete your own account. When you create a new bank user account, you are then shown a link to set up the user's permissions.
Reset user passwords.

section.title: User Maintenance - Profiles
section.para: Maintain user accounts. A user's account details are called his or her profile.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing user accounts at your bank. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page.

note.para: The Status and Maker User fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: The list of existing user accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: First Name and Last Name of the user.
Login Id used by the user to log into Fusion Corporate Channels. This login Id uniquely identifies a user account within the bank.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

You can modify an account by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

You cannot delete your own account. A bank's main default administrator account bankadmin cannot be deleted at all. Therefore the entries for these accounts do not have the Delete
icon.
Click the Add a new user button at the bottom of the list to add an account.

Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank (except that the Company is set to your bank) and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the user's account. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.

section.title: Overview
section.para: Fusion Corporate Channels can be configured to send emails to specified users to alert them when your bank receives transactions from clients; for instance a request for an Import Letter of Credit or Funds Transfer. This is particularly useful to improve your bank's cash and trade services workflow. Alerts can also be sent at chosen milestones, for instance Expiry date or Last Shipment date.
For an administrator at a bank, the Alerts module is used to specify, for a given product and transaction type or milestone date, the users who are to receive alerts.

You can specify that an alert be sent to the user who played a specific part in handling the transaction: input, control or release. In this case, the email address and the language to use (English or French) are taken from the user's data in the system. Alternatively, you can enter any email address. In this case, you must select the language explicitly. You cannot enter or modify the body of the email's content, standard content is used.
The set of actions for which alerts can be sent is configured by the bank in a system configuration file.

note.para: Additional custom types of alerts (for example, SMS messages) could also be available and configured in this module.

section.title: Alerts Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Alerts Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Alerts Maintenance from the left navigation menu.

section.title: Alerts Maintenance Options
section.para: The following options are provided for Alerts Maintenance on the left navigation menu:

listitem.para: Define alerts to be sent when notifications are received from the bank.
Define alerts to be sent when specific milestone dates are reached, passed, or approaching.

section.title: Alerts Maintenance - Submission
section.para: This option allows the bank administrator to define alerts to be sent when notifications are received from a bank. The bank details are displayed at the top of the page along with a list of existing Alerts defined for that bank.

The list of existing Alerts has the following columns (use asterisk character "*" to search for all items from the list):
Field
Description
Product
Products for which the alert is to be sent.
Sub product
Sub product for the selected product.
Type
Transaction types for which the alert is to be sent.
Product Status
Status of the product transaction when an alert is to be sent.
Company
Customer ID submitting the transaction
Amount Threshold
Currency and amount greater than or less than conditions that will trigger an alert.
E-Mail Address
The person that should receive the alert.

You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add Alert button at the bottom of the list to add a new alert. The change alert and new alert screens are the same except the fields in the change alert screen contain existing details.

section.title: Add Alert Form
section.para: When you select this option, you are presented with the following sub form. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

note.para: Click Save when you have made your changes. If you simply navigate away from the page, your changes will be lost, even though you have clicked OK on the sub-form(s) where you made the changes and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Products for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list. Select wildcard to mean all products.
Sub Products of the selected Product, for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list. Select wildcard to mean all sub products.
Transaction types for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list.: New, Amend, Message, Reporting. Select wildcard to mean all types.
The current status of the product for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list (for example, Rejected, Pending, New, and so on.). Select wildcard to mean all statuses.
Customer for which the alert is to be sent. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from a list of valid customers. Mandatory field if present. Select wildcard to mean all companies.
Select : Less Than, or Greater Than, and the currency and amount to determine the conditions under which an alert should be sent. Select asterisk if you want to send an alert regardless of the amount
Select the recipient to receive the alert. Options are:Input User Control User Release User Custom Recipient - (When selected, Language / Locale and Email Address fields are made available)
Select the Recipient Language from the dropdown menu. Only available if Recipient is selected as Custom Recipient.
Email address of the Recipient. Only available if Recipient is selected as Custom Recipient.
Click to add the new alert to the list.
Click to abandon creating the alert, and close the sub-form.

section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a popup window will appear to confirm the choice.

row.entry:
Save the new alert definition.
Remember to click Save when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made, has been clicked, and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.
Open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

section.para: This option allows the bank administrator to display and define alerts to be sent, when specific milestone dates are reached, passed, or approaching. Bank details are displayed at the top of the page along with a list of existing calendar alerts defined for that company

note.para: Click Save when you have made your changes. If you simply navigate away from the page, your changes will be lost, even though you have clicked OK on the sub-form(s) where you made the changes and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Bank's abbreviated name that is part of the user identification in Fusion Corporate Channels.
This section contains a list of existing alerts, with columns showing Product, Date and Email Address. Click Add Alert to open another sub-form to add an alert. The sub-form is as follows:
Product for which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list. You cannot use wildcard.
Milestone date, relative to which the alert is to be sent. Select from the dropdown list. The dates available depend on the Product selected.
Customer for which the alert is to be sent. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from a list of valid customers. Mandatory field if present. Select wildcard to mean all companies.
Number of days before or after Date, that the alert is to be sent. Blank to have it sent on the date itself. Mandatory if you have selected Before or After.
Pair of option buttons for you to show whether the value in Offset is days before or after the date in Date. Mandatory if you have entered a value in Offset.
Select the recipient to receive the alert. Options are:Input User Control User Release User Custom Recipient - (When selected, Language / Locale and Email Address fields are made available)
Language to use in the alert. Select from the dropdown list: English or French. If you selected anything other than blank for Recipient, you cannot set this (it remains blank).
Email address to send the alert to. Select from the dropdown list: English or French. If you selected anything other than blank for Recipient, you cannot set this (it remains blank).
Click to add the new alert to the list.
Click to abandon creating the alert, and close the sub-form.

section.para:
In the list of existing alerts within the above form, you can modify an alert by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

row.entry:
Save the new alert definition.
Remember to click Save when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made, has been clicked, and they are shown on the list within the form.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Report Designer module to design reports, which can then be run by all users in your company. These reports cover the products available in Fusion Corporate Channels such as letters of credit, guarantees, and so on.

The form for designing a report has a checkbox labelled Publish Report. As long as you do not tick this, the report is not made available to your users even if you save it. The report is said to be not executable. When you have finished designing the report and want to release it so users can execute it, you should then tick this checkbox.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: In this chapter, we use the word "report" to mean a report design, rather than an actual generated report. Thus for example "updating a report" means updating the specification of the report, rather than generating a new report with the latest figures.

section.title: Report Designer - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Report Designer function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Report Designer from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Report Designer Options
section.para: The Report Designer options are part of the System Features menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Create a report from a blank form.
Create a report from an existing report.
Create a report from a template supplied to your company by your bank.
Update an existing report.
Create or update a bank report template.
Alter report parameters
Define report schedules

section.title: Report Designer - Create
section.para: This option is used by the Bank Administrator to create a report from a blank form.
When you select this option, you are presented with the blank form. The form is as follows. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

section.title: Create Form - General Details
section.para: In this section, you give high level information about the report.

entry.para: Name of the report. Your users will identify it by this name.
Tick here so that when you save the report it will be made available for all users in your company to execute. Leave it unticked until you are satisfied with your design of the report.
Maximum number of lines per page. Defaults to 25.

section.title: Create Form - Products
section.para: In this section, you list the product types to be covered by the report.
There are two types of reports:

listitem.para: A single-product report is a report on a single product (for example, LC).
A multi-product report is a report on several products (for example, LC + EL)

section.para: If you define a single-product report, you can include in it all the fields of the selected product. If you define a multi-product report, you can include only fields common to all products.

You specify the product(s) to include from a dropdown list on the Product field in the form. For a single-product report, or the first product of a multi-product report, the dropdown list includes all products available to your company.

Fusion Corporate Channels distinguishes between transactions (the individual messages that pass between client and bank), masters (the master file describing the product, in its latest state), and templates (the templates from which you can create some types of product). A report can only cover one of these three types.

For example, say a client initiates a Letter of Credit for 1000 GBP. That creates a transaction. When the bank approves it, a master is created. If the bank subsequently sends a message changing the amount to 500 GBP, a new transaction is created and the master is updated. The master always reflects the latest state of a file.

Whichever type you select for your first product - master, transaction, or template - the dropdown list for subsequent products you add offers you only that type. For example, if you select Letter of Credit Transaction as the first product, then for subsequent products you can select among Export Letter of Credit Transaction, Export Collection Transaction, and so on.

entry.para: This checkbox indicates if the report is multi-product or single-product. Defaults to not checked.

The rest of this section is a list of products that the report is to cover. If none has been selected yet, there is simply the text No product selected instead. Click Add Product to open a sub-form to add one. You cannot add more than one if Multi-product Report is not ticked. The sub-form is as follows:
A product to include in the report. Select from the dropdown list. See the explanation above regarding the content of this list..
Click to add the product to the list of products.
Click to close the form and not add its contents to the list.

section.para:
You can change a product by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Once you have specified the product or products to be included, further sections are displayed where you can define the displayed columns, parameters, filters, overall aggregation and grouping.
If these details are already defined and the current product is changed, these details are removed. If no product is selected, these sections disappear.

section.title: Create Form - Displayed columns
section.para: In this section, you list the columns that are to appear in the report.

entry.para: Tick here to have the widths of the columns expressed with absolute values.

When this item is not ticked, the widths of the columns are relative. In the displayed column, a character % appears after the width field. When you save the report, a check is done to ensure that the total of the widths is equal to 100%.

The rest of this section is a list of columns that the report is to include. If none has been selected yet, there is simply the text No displayed columns instead. Click Add Column to open a sub-form to add one. The sub-form is as follows:
A column to be included in the report.Select from the dropdown list. The list of available columns depends on the selected product.
Column heading to be used when the user executing the report is English-speaking. If left blank, the column name is used.
Click the plus sign to display fields where you can specify column headings for the other languages available. These are optional. Click the minus sign to hide these fields again.
Alignment of the column. Select from the dropdown list: middle, left, right. If you don't select an alignment, the column is centered.
Width of the column. If no width is given, the column is sized automatically.
(Only present when the column is an amount.) Currency to use to express the amount. Click the magnifying glass icon to select the currency code.
Click to add the column to the list of displayed columns.
Click to abandon adding the column and close the form.
Tick to show if the report is to be ordered by default upon its execution. Default value is not checked.
(Only present when Order Report by Default is ticked.) Column on which the report will be ordered by default. Select from the dropdown list, which includes the columns displayed in the report.
Type of the order by default. Select from the dropdown list: Ascending, Descending. Defaults to Ascending.

section.para:
You can change a column's description by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it from the report by clicking the Delete
icon. You can reorder the columns by using the Move Up
icon to move a column up in the order of appearance in the report and similarly use the Move Down
icon to move a column down.

section.title: Create Form - Parameters

note.para: This should not be confused with the Parameters function on the System Features menu, which is described in the Report Designer - Parameters section.

section.para: In this section, you list the parameters that are to be used in the report.

A parameter is the way to ask the user to enter a value to be used in executing the report. For example, you can design a report of existing letters of credit, define a parameter Expiry Date and include a filter using this parameter - for instance, letters of credit with an expiry date earlier than this parameter. Upon executing the report, the user would be asked to enter an expiry date. The resulting list would display all letters of credit with an expiry date earlier than the one entered.
Click the Add Parameter button to add a new Parameter to the report. The following fields are displayed in a sub form.

entry.para: This section is a list of parameters that the report is to have. If none has been defined yet, there is simply the text No Parameter instead. Click Add Parameter to open a sub-form to add one. The sub-form is as follows:
Label to be used when the user executing the report is English-speaking. Mandatory. This label will appear in front of the input field displayed for this parameter when the report is executed.
Click the plus sign to display fields where you can specify labels for the other languages available. These are optional. Click the minus sign to hide these fields again.
Tick to that this parameter is mandatory when executing the report. Default value is not checked.
Click to add the parameter to the list of parameters.
Click to abandon adding the parameter and close the form.

section.para:
You can change a parameter's description by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it from the report by clicking the Delete
icon.

section.title: Create Form - Filters
section.para: In this section, you list the filters that are to be used in the report. A filter is a way of selecting a subset of products. A filter is made of one or more criteria. Each criterion describes a constraint.

When the report is executed, the items included in the report are the ones that meet the constraints described by at least one of the filters. An item meets the constraints of a filter, when it meets the constraints of each criterion within this filter.
This section is a list of filters that the report is to have. If none has been defined yet, there is simply the text No filter instead. Click Add Filter to open a sub-form to add one.

entry.para: Each sub-form is itself a list of criteria that constitute the filter. If none gave been defined yet, there is simply the text No Criteria. Click Add Criteria to open a sub-sub-form to add one.
The column on which to apply the criterion. Select from the dropdown list.

Limitation : the fields Description of Goods, Documents Required, Additional Instructions, Charges Details, Additional Amount, Payment Instructions, Period of Presentation, Shipment Period, Sender to Receiver and Full Details are not accessible.
The criterion's operator. Select from the dropdown list. The list of available operators depends on the above selected column type. Some examples are:

listitem.para: Different, Equal, Like operators are available for string columns,
Different, Equal, Inferior, Inferior or Equal, Superior, Superior or Equal operators are available for date columns,
Different, Equal, Inferior, Inferior or Equal, Superior, Superior or Equal operators are available for amount columns,
Different, Equal, Inferior, Inferior or Equal, Superior, Superior or Equal operators are available for number columns.

row.entry: Options buttons to select whether the operand is a parameter or a value.

entry.para: The list of parameters as defined in the Parameters section.
Only present when the operand type selected is Parameter.
Only present when the operand type selected is Value and the selected column is of type string.This field may Have a dropdown menu.
The value as a string. Only present when the operand type selected is Value and the selected column is of type string.
Currency code and amount. Maximum length of amount is 15 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon to select the currency code.
Only present when the operand type selected is Value and the selected column is of type amount.
Only present when the operand type selected is Value and the selected column is of type date.
The operand is a pre-defined value. (Only available for date fields)

row.entry: The current date Plus (+) or Minus (-) a specified number of days.

para.guilabel: First day of the current month +

row.entry: The First day of the current month, Plus (+) or Minus (-) a specified number of days.

para.guilabel: Last day of the current month +

row.entry: The Last day of the current month, Plus (+) or Minus (-) a specified number of days.

entry.para: Click to add the criterion to the list of criteria.
Click to abandon adding the criterion and close the form.

You can change a filter's description by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it from the report by clicking the Delete
icon.

section.title: Create Form - Overall aggregates
section.para: In this section, you list the aggregates that are to be included in the report. It is possible to compute aggregates on a column of the report, for example a sum over a column. These overall aggregates are based on the whole report, unlike the aggregates you define in Grouping (see below), which can be based on parts of the report.
Possible aggregates are:

entry.para: Displays the number of items in the report's list.
Displays the average value of the selected column.
Displays the maximum value of the selected column.
Display the minimum value of the selected column.
Displays the sum of values of the selected column.

section.para: The following fields are accessible in the Overall Aggregates section:

entry.para: This section is a list of aggregates that the report is to include. If none has been defined yet, there is simply the text No Aggregate instead. Click Add Aggregate to open a sub-form to add one. The sub-form is as follows:

The aggregate operator. The list of available aggregate operators depends on the above selected column type:

Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for a date column,
Sum, Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for an amount column,
Sum, Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for a number column.

Currency to use to express the aggregated amount. Click the magnifying glass icon to select the currency code. (Only present when the above selected column is an amount.)

Click to abandon adding the aggregate and close the form.

You can change an aggregates description by clicking the Edit

section.title: Create Form - Grouping
section.para: In this section, you specify how lines in the report are to be ordered and grouped, and can define aggregates over groups you have defined.

Grouping on a column orders the lines in the report so that all lines where that column has the same value are grouped together. You can define an aggregate for each group in the same manner as for overall aggregates (see above).

entry.para: Tick this box if you want to use a grouping in your report.
Column on which grouping will be applied.

The rest of this section is a list of aggregates that the report is to include. If none has been defined yet, there is simply the text No Aggregate instead. Click Add Aggregate to open a sub-form to add one. The sub-form is as follows:

The aggregate operator. The list of available aggregate operators depends on the above selected column type:

listitem.para: Count aggregate operator is available for a string column,
Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for a date column,
Sum, Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for an amount column,
Sum, Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for a number column.

entry.para: Label to be used when the user executing the report is English-speaking. If left blank, the column name is used, followed by the aggregate type.

section.title: Create Form - Chart
section.para: In this section, you specify whether the report is to include a chart, and what kind of chart.

para.guilabel: Create a chart for this report

entry.para: Tick this box if you want to include a chart in your report. The fields described below appear when you tick this box.
Type of chart. Select from the dropdown list: Pie, Bar, Line, etc.
Column to be used as the X-axis or other baseline (depending on the type of chart). Select from the dropdown list.
Select the scale or the X Axis from the dropdown list. (depending on the type of chart)
Click to display a popup form where you can specify the column to be used as the Y axis. The form is describe below.

Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for a date column,
Sum, Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for an amount column,

section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a pop up window will appear to confirm the choice.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.
Open a pop up window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Report Designer - From Existing
section.para: Create a report from an existing report. The details of the existing report are copied to the new one, except the report name, description and executable status. This is set to non-executable.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of existing reports. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name field at the top of the page.
The columns show the Report Name and Report Description of each report.

Click in the Report Name column to open a new report form, populated with the details from the selected existing report. The description of each field in the report can be found in the section on Report Designer - Create Form

section.title: Report Designer - From Template
section.para: Create a report from a template supplied to your company by your bank.

The template name is used as the report's name. If this name is already used by an existing report, the report name is suffixed with the string [i] where i is an incremental index that distinguishes the new report name.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of report templates that your company has. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name, Report Description and/or Product Code fields at the top of the page.
The columns show the Report Name and the Report Description of each template.

The user selects the required templates through the dedicated check-boxes, and then press the Load button. The description of each field in the report can be found in the section on Report Designer - Create Form

section.title: Report Designer - Maintenance
section.para: Update an existing report.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of existing reports. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name field at the top of the page.
The columns show the Report Name, Report Description and Executable flag of each report.

You can modify a report by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, delete it by clicking the Delete
icon, or preview it by clicking the Preview
icon. Previewing it executes it, using your own permissions and your own company's data.

section.title: Report Designer - Bank Template Maintenance
section.para: Create and maintain Bank templates that can be used by the bank's clients.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of existing reports. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name, Description and/or Product fields at the top of the page.
The columns show the Report Name, Report Description and Released flag of each report.

You can modify a report by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, delete it by clicking the Delete
icon, or preview it by clicking the Preview
icon. In addition. New templates can be added by clicking the Add a new report template button at the bottom of the screen.
A Bank Template is not necessarily a complete report, but more often a set of common values or parameters that can be used by the Bank's clients to create their own reports.

When a new template is created or an existing one edited, the General Details, Products and Displayed columns sections of the of the Report Designer - Create Form are displayed and can have values assigned to them. Note that the Template Name and Template description fields are used to identify the template to the client, and may not necessarily have a direct relationship to the report name created by the client.

section.title: Report Designer - Parameters
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Report PDF Parameters module to set up parameters such as logo, header and footer texts for PDF documents generated from custom reports.

note.para: This should not be confused with the Parameters, which is described in the Create form - Parameters section.

section.para: When you click this function, you are presented with a blank form.

section.title: Parameters Form
section.para: The form is as follows. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

entry.para: Click the Browse button to enter the name of an image file to attach to reports.
The logo should be a .GIF or .JPG image. The recommended size is 50x150 pixels.
We recommend you generate a test report in PDF format to check the logo is rendered correctly, and adjust and reload the logo size.
Text to appear next to the logo at the top of the page, on the left hand side. Three lines of 35 characters.
Text to appear in the centre of the footer. Up to 65 characters.

section.title: Parameters Form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a pop up window will appear to confirm the choice.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.
Open a pop up window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Report Designer - Schedule
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Schedule Report module to schedule reports to be executed automatically at a given frequency, with the results sent to a specified recipient via email. There is no need for any user to actually be connected to Fusion Corporate Channels while a scheduled report is running. The report is executed as if it was being run by a user with access to the company's full jurisdiction (that is, with access to all available permissions given to the company and all its entities). You can select the format (CSV, Spreadsheet or PDF) of the results sent as an email attachment and the language in which the report is generated.

You cannot customise the actual time of day when a scheduled report is executed. This is configured in the technical properties of the Fusion Corporate Channels application and defined by the Bank technical administrator.

When you click this function, you are presented with a list of all the existing scheduled reports. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name and/or Frequency fields at the top of the page.

The list of scheduled reports has the following columns:
Field
Description
Report Name
Report Name
Frequency
Batch Frequency (Daily, Weekly or Monthly). Depending on the frequency, additional information is provided:
Weekly: the abbreviated name for the chosen day of the week.
Monthly: the day of the month (as a number).
Output Format
Chosen Output format :
CSV: Comma Separated Value.
Spreadsheet: format compatible with Microsoft Excel.
PDF: Adobe Acrobat format.
Next Batch
For information, the date of the next report execution is indicated.

You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add a new report schedule button at the bottom of the list to add an report to the schedule.

section.title: Schedule Report Form
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the schedule for the report. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

listitem.para: Weekly: the user has to choose the day of the week.
Montly: the user has to select the day of the month

entry.para: The format of the attachment containing the results of the report and which is going to be included in the email sent upon the scheduled date is defined here:

listitem.para: CSV for a Comma Separated Value file,
Spreadsheet for a format compatible with Microsoft Excel,
PDF for the Adobe Acrobat format.

entry.para: Select box with all available languages. This choice will determine in which language the report will be executed and therefore the language of the results. It is also used to set the language of the actual email message.
The email address of the recipient (40 characters maximum).

section.title: Parameter Maintenance
section.para: A bank administrator can define standard parameters for Financial Holidays and Financial Cutoff Times for different products and Product types within the Fusion Corporate Channels.

Selecting this function will display a parameter Type field to select either Financial Holidays and Financial Cutoff Times. Click the select button after the choice is made, to display a list of defined parameters.

section.para: To navigate to the Parameter Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Parameter Maintenance from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Parameter Maintenance - Selection
section.para: Selecting this function will display a parameter Type field to select either Financial Holidays and Financial Cutoff Times, from a drop down menu.
Click the select button after the choice is made, to display a list of defined parameters.

section.title: Overview

Guarantees are mainly free form documents describing the type and content of the Guarantee. Bankers Guarantees are used by customers in the Trade Finance area or the portal.
Selecting this function will display a display a list of Existing Guarantee templates.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a bank, you can add a credit facility that banks give their customers and allocate limits across the customer's various branches. At this moment, this feature is applicable only for Banker Guarantee.

section.title: Facility Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Facility Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Facility Maintenance from the left navigation menu.

section.title: Facility Maintenance - Customer Facility List
section.para: This option is used by the Bank Administrator and the Bank Group Administrator to Maintain Facility details for customers. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing customers at your bank or bank group. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name, Bank, Facility Reference, Ccy., Facility and Review Date fields at the top of the page. Click the Download File button to download the list in CSV and Spreadsheet (MS Excel) format.
The list of existing customers has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name that uniquely identifies the customer. This is part of the login data that a customer user must give to log into Fusion Corporate Channels.
Name of the Bank. Selct from the dropdown. valid Values are Misys Group and DEMOBANK.

section.para: You can access further details for a customer by clicking on the required row. You are displayed the Customer Facility List with the details shown in the table below.

entry.para: The reference details for the facility.

The future date to review the extension of the facility to the customer. If not extended by this date, the facility is withdrawn automatically.
The base currency for the facility.
The amount allocated to the facility.
The balance amount available after utilisation by the customer.
The amount utilised out of the total allocated by the bank to the facility.

The amount that is awaiting approval by the bank.
This information is available if the configuration has been set by the application administrator to wait for approval by the bank. However, if the administrator has set it for direct submission by the customer, this field is not applicable.
The percentage utilised out of the total amount allocated.

entry.para: This indicates the status of the facility, whether, it is active or inactive.
Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

icon. These icons are available if maker-checker is enabled for your profile.

section.title: Facility Definition Form - Action Buttons

row.entry:
Save the facility definition.
Remember to click Save when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made, has been clicked, and they are shown on the list within the form.

Open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

chapter.title: FSCM Program
chapter.para: FSCM Programs are created from the Bank side through TI or back office systems and can be viewed by corporate users in portal while raising invoices and requesting for financing. You can view the FSCM Program link to a customer.

To navigate to the FSCM Program function, from the tool bar, select System Features > FSCM Program. Then select FSCM Program List from the left side navigation menu. By selecting this option, a list of customer will be displayed.
You can search customer by entering Abbreviated Name or Name in the field provided.
You can then select a Customer which will display a list of FSCM Program link to the customer selected.
You can use the Search Option in the available fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Program code, Program Name and status field.
The columns returned in the list of Invoice records are the following:

entry.para: Code of the program assigned by the bank.
Name of the program decided by the bank.
The status of the FSCM Program (active/inactive).

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a bank,you can add billing organisations which will be used as the payee under the Fund Transfer>Bill Payment function. This will also include details on how to register the payee before creating the Bill Payment transactions. Bill Payment allows a customer user to pay their monthly bills online or other billing statement as long as they have the bill reference and the billing Organization exists.

section.title: Biller Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Biller Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Biller Maintenance from the left navigation menu.

section.title: Biller Maintenance Options
section.para: The Biller Maintenance options that are part of the left menu are listed in the following:

listitem.para: Maintain billing organisation details for customers to request payment of specific bills.

section.title: Biller Maintenance - Bill Payment
section.para: This option is used by the Bank Administrator to Maintain Billers details for customers. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing Biller accounts at your bank. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Biller Code, Payee Name, Category, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page.

note.para: The Status and Actor fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: The list of existing Billers has the following columns:

entry.para: Unique Biller code to identify the Billing Organization in the back office

row.entry: Termination date of the Billing Organisation.

entry.para: This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can modify Biller by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

Cancel a transaction by clicking on the Cancel
icon or approve by clicking the Action
icon. These icons are available if maker-checker is enabled for your profile.
Click the Add Biller button at the bottom of the list to add a Biller.
Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Edit it is preset with the details of the existing Biller. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

section.title: Billing Organisation Form - Billing Organisation Details
section.para:
The Billing Organisation Details section of the form is as follows:
Field
Type
Description
Biller Code
Enter the unique Biller code to identify the Billing Organization in the back office.
English Payee Name
Biller name, in English.
Local Payee Name
Biller Name, in the local language.

Select the category from the drop down menu.
Description
Enter a description of the Billing Organisation. Click the
button to the right of this field, to select predefined phrases to insert into this field.
Currency
Enter the currency Code for the Biller. Click the magnifying glass
icon to display and select from a list of valid currency codes.
End Date
Enter the end date for the Bill.
File Path for Sample Bill
Specify the HTML/PDF path of the image with the bill reference sample for the billing organization.
Additional Information
(line 1)
Specify a disclaimer message to be displayed in the transaction screen when the payee is selected.

Remember to click Submit when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made, has been clicked, and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.
Open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

section.para: This section defines the bill reference details. Existing Bill Reference details will be displayed in a list in this section.

You can modify an existing Bill Reference by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon or click the Add Bill reference button at the bottom of the list to add a new reference.

entry.para: Enter the unique reference id for the biller code.
Specify the label of the bill reference to be displayed (in English) in the customer bill payment transaction.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a bank,you can add license definitions, which will be used by your client users in the menu Trade Services > License. It will allow your customers to select a type of license defined to link it to transactions and allocate the amount to transactions for creation of license against the attributes thus defined.

section.title: License Definition - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the License Definition function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select License Definition from the left navigation menu.

section.title: License Definition - List of Licenses Associated to Customers
section.para: This option is used by the Bank Administrator to maintain License Definition details for customers. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing License Definitions at your bank. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Name and Type fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing License Definitions has the following columns:

entry.para: Type of License. The options are: Import License, Export License and FX License.
Customers linked to the license definition.

section.para:
You can modify a License Definition by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. Click the Add a New License Definition button at the bottom of the list to add a License Definition. Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Edit it is preset with the details of an existing License Definition. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

section.title: License Definition Form - License Details
section.para:
The License Details section of the form is as follows:
Field
Type
Description
License Type
Types of License. Valid options are: Import License, Export License and FX License.
This field is non-editable on the update form.
License Name
Name of the License as given in the License definition. It is a three character alphanumeric field.
This field is non-editable on the update form.
License Description
Description for the license with relevant details.
Defaults
Define the default information for the license definition such as multi currency and overdraw. The fields below provide the details.
These are attributes for the specific license definition, which will be defaulted during license creation by the client.
Multi Currency
Select (check) this box to link the license with transactions in other currencies. Leave it blank or uncheck to restrict the use fo the license in the currency selected during license creation.
Allow Overdraw
Select (check) this box to allow overdraw facility on the drawdown amount. By default, the drawdown amount is set to the same as the payment amount.
Allow Multiple Licenses
Select (check) this box to allow multiple licenses to be available for drawdowns for a transaction. This helps your users to split the payment across several licenses.
Allow Override
Select (check) this box to allow increase or decrease of the allocated amount or the transaction amount of the license.
Principal Details
Details of the principal party availing the license. The fields below provide the details.
Allow Override
Select (check) this box to allow modifications to the Label for Principal field shown below.
Label for Principal
Principal party role for the license type selected. By default, it is Exporter for Export License, Applicant for Import License and Payer for FX License.
Principal party label defaults to Applicant, Exporter or Payer depending on the type of license selected.
Non Principal Details
Details of the party receiving the goods or services. The fields below provide the details.
Allow Override
Select (check) this box to allow modifications to the Label for Non Principal field shown below.
Label for Non Principal
Non Principal party role for the license type selected. By default, it is Consignee for Export License, Beneficiary for Import License and Payee for FX License.
Non Princpal party label defaults to Beneficiary, Consignee and Payee depending on the type of license selected.
Non Principal Default
Select the type of Non Principal party that can use the license from the following options:
Non-Principal Only Non-Principal in Country Any Non-Principal
Associated Products
Select the products to associate with the License Definition.
Associated Products List
List of products that are associated to the license definition. The columns displayed are: Product, Sub Product Type and Product Type.
You can modify the associated products for a license definition by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Add Products
Click this button to associate products to a license definition. Editing an existing association or creating a new one displays the same popup form, but in the case of editing, it is preset with the existing details. The fields below provide the details.
Product
Product that this license is applied to. Select from the dropdown list. Valid options are:Import Letter of Credit Issued Standby LC Export Letter of Credit Fund Transfer Import Collection Export Collection Banker's Gurantee Banker's Guarantee Received Financing Request Received Standby LC
Sub Product Type
The sub product type for the selected product, if applicable. Wildcard if it applies to all types.* Credit Bills Purchased Export Bills Exchange Purchase Export Discounting Collection Export Discounting LC Export Invoice Financing Freight Loan Import Invoice Financing Import Loan Collection Import Loan LC Other Other Export Financing Other Import Financing Packing Credit Trust Receipt
Product Type
The product type for the selected product, if applicable. Wildcard if it applies to all types.* Advance Payment Guarantee BID Bond Customs Guarantee Deferred Payment Guarantee Maintenance Guarantee Payment Guarantee Performance Guarantee Repayment Guarantee Retention Guarantee Tender Guarantee Performance Guarantee (Delivery Obligation) Performance Guarantee (Warranty Obligation) Performance Guarantee (Contractual Obligation) Credit Facilities Guarantee Bill of Lading Guarantee Lease Guarantee Other
Product type is available only for Banker's Guarantee and Received Banker's Guarantee
Ok
Click to add or update the details in the popup.
Cancel
Click to abandon the add or update operation in the popup, and close the sub-form.
Associated Customers
Select the customers to associate with the License Definition.
Valid for all customers
Select (check) this box if the license definition is to be made available to all customers in the associated customers list.
Uncheck this box to view the Add a Customer button if no customers have been associated yet.
Checking this box and saving the form will delete any existing associated customers that you have added. If you do not wish to perform this procedure, click the Cancel button on the form.
Associated Customers List
Define the Customers that can use the license definition. If Customers have already been defined, you can modify them by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Add a Customer
Click this button to allow a new customer to access this license definition. Editing an existing association or creating a new one displays the same popup form, but in the case of editing, it is preset with the existing details. The fields below provide the details.
Entity
Select the entity that is to have access to this license definition. Click on the magnifying glass for a list of customers and entities.
Abbreviated Name
The company ID the entity belongs to. This field will be automatically populated when the entity is selected.
Name
The Name of the Company the entity belongs to. This field will be automatically populated when the entity is selected.
Ok
Click to add or update the details in the popup.
Cancel
Click to abandon the add or update operation in the popup, and close the sub-form.

row.entry:
Save the license definition.
Remember to click Save when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made, has been clicked, and they are shown on the list within the form.
