section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a bank, you can accept or reject new counterparty created by the customer.

section.title: Associate CounterParty
section.para: You can view and modify the counterparties that are associated to a customer or in pending.
To navigate to the Associate CounterParty function, from the tool bar, select System Features > CounterParty Maintenance. Then select Associate CounterParty from the left side navigation menu.

To use this function, click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are CounterParty Abbv Name, Company Abbv Name and Association Status fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Associated counterparty are the following:

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the company link to the counterparty
Abbreviated name of the customer link to this counterparty.
The status of the association (pending / associated)
Date of the request of association.

section.para: Each record is shown with one or more of the following action icons to the left of the entry, depending on its status:

entry.para: You can't view or edit the master details
Click to open a popup window displaying the current master details of the record. (Submitted entries may only be viewed)
Click to edit the current master details of the record.(Only Draft and Incomplete (unauthorised) entries can be edited)

section.title: Active CounterParty Customer
section.para: This feature present the CounterParty that are pending for activation

To navigate to the Active CounterParty Customer function, from the tool bar, select System Features > CounterParty Maintenance. Then select Active CounterParty Customer from the left side navigation menu.
To use this function, click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are CounterParty Abbv Name and Company Abbv Name fields.

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the company link to the counterparty
Abbreviated name of the customer link to this counterparty.
Date of the request of association.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As a bank group administrator, you can link customers across different banks or branches by creating a trust relationship. You can then link users of these customers and enable them to view account balances in a uni-directional or bi-directional exchange of information.

note.para: Trust relationship is not available for multi-bank customers.

section.title: Trust Relationship - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Trust Relationship function, from the toolbar, select System Features from the home page, then select Trust Relationship from the left navigation menu.

section.title: Trust Relationship - Customer Level List
section.para: You (Bank Group Administrators) can use this option to create and manage trust relationship details for your Bank's customers. When you select the Customer Level option, you are presented with a list of all the existing customer level trust relationships for your banks. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the From Bank, To Bank, From Customer, To Customer, Relation (*, Uni-directional and Bi-directional), Relationship Status (*, Active and Inactive), Status and Actor fields at the top of the page. Click the Download File button to download the list in CSV and Spreadsheet (MS Excel) format.

note.para: Status and Actor fields are available only if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: You can view the following columns in the list of trust relationships:

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the bank to which the customer establishing the trust relationship belongs to.
Abbreviated name of the bank to which the customer with whom the relationship is established with belongs to.
Abbreviated name of the customer from where Regional Account View may be accessed.
Abbreviated name of the customer with whom the trust relationship is established.
Type of relationship established at the customer level, whether Uni-directional or Bi-directional.
Status of the relationship, whether active or inactive.
Indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can modify a trust relationship by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

note.para: Once user-level associations are set up, you cannot delete a trust relationship.

section.para: Click the Add a new trust relationship button at the bottom of the list to add a trust relationship. Edit and Add a new trust relationship display the same form, but in the case of Edit, the From Bank, To Bank, From Customer and To Customer fields are not editable.

Cancel a transaction by clicking on the Cancel
icon or approve by clicking the Action
icon. These icons are available if maker-checker is enabled for your profile.

section.title: Trust Relationship Form - Customer Level Details
section.para: The Trust Relationship form for customers has the following details:

row.entry: This section has details for the customers and their banks that form the trust relationship.

entry.para: Click on the magnifying glass icon and select the bank to which the customer establishing the trust relationship belongs to. The List of Banks popup opens and you can click on the Abbreviated Name column to select the required bank.

Click on the magnifying glass icon and select the customer who wants to establish the relationship.The List of Customers popup opens and you can click on the Abbreviated Name column to select the required customer. The list of customers available is linked to the Bank you selected from From Bank.

Click on the magnifying glass icon and select the bank to which the customer with whom the trust relationship is being established belongs to. The List of Banks popup opens and you can click on the Abbreviated Name column to select the required bank.

Click on the magnifying glass icon and select the customer with whom the trust relationship is being established.The List of Customers popup opens and you can click on the Abbreviated Name column to select the required customer. The list of customers available is linked to the Bank you selected from To Bank.
Select the status of the trust relationship from the options: Active and Inactive.

Select the direction of flow of information once the trust relationship is established. The options are: Uni-directional and Bi-directional. Uni-directional allows the flow of information from From Customer to To Customer and Bi-directional allows between both customers.

warning.para: Once you have selected Bi-directional and users have been linked between two customers, you cannot change to Uni-directional. However, if you have selected Uni-directional, you can change it to Bi-directional anytime.

section.title: Trust Relationship Customer Level Form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a popup window will appear to confirm the choice.

row.entry:
Save the trust relationship and submit it to the system.
Remember to click Submit when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made has been clicked and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.
Open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Trust Relationship - User Level List
section.para: You (Bank Group Administrators) can use this option to create and manage trust relationship details for users of customers in your Banks. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing customer level trust relationships for your bank's customers. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the From Bank, To Bank, From Customer, To Customer, Relation (*, Uni-directional and Bi-directional) and Relationship Status (*, Active and Inactive) fields at the top of the page. Click the Download File button to download the list in CSV and Spreadsheet (MS Excel) format.
You can view the following columns in the list of user level trust relationships:

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the bank to which the customer establishing the trust relationship belongs to.
Abbreviated name of the bank to which the customer with whom the relationship is established with belongs to.
Abbreviated name of the customer creating the trust relationship.
Abbreviated name of the customer with whom the trust relationship is created.
Type of relationship established at the customer level, whether Uni-directional or Bi-directional.
Status of the relationship, whether active or inactive.

section.para: You can access the trust relationships at user level for a customer by clicking the required row. You are displayed the Trust Relationship at User Level screen.

On this screen, you can search the list by entering search criteria in the From User, To User, Relation (*, Uni-directional and Bi-directional), Relationship Status (*, Active and Inactive), Status and Actor fields at the top of the page. Click the Download File button to download the list in CSV and Spreadsheet (MS Excel) format.
You are displayed the Trust Relationship at User Level with the details shown in the table below.

entry.para: Login ID of the user establishing the trust relationship.

note.para: The From User can access Regional Account View and view accounts of both customers (From Customer and To Customer) when a uni-directional set up is selected. The From User and To User can view each others accounts when a bi-directional set up is selected.

entry.para: Login ID of the user with whom the relationship is being established.
Type of relationship established at the user level, whether Uni-directional or Bi-directional.
Status of the relationship, whether active or inactive.
Indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can modify a trust relationship by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. Click the Add a new trust relationship button at the bottom of the list to add a trust relationship. Edit and Add a new trust relationship display the same form.

Cancel a transaction by clicking on the Cancel
icon or approve by clicking the Action
icon. These icons are available if maker-checker is enabled for your profile.
The Create or Modify Trust Relationship at User Level form is described in the following subsections.

section.title: Trust Relationship Form - User Level Details
section.para: The Trust Relationship form for the user level has the following details:

row.entry: This section has details for the linking of the customers' users and their banks to form the trust relationship.

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the bank to which the customer establishing the trust relationship belongs to.
Abbreviated name for the customer belonging to From Bank wanting to establish the relationship.

Click on the magnifying glass icon and select the user who has to be linked to establish the relationship. The List of Users popup opens and you can click on the Abbreviated Name column to select the required user. The list of users available is linked to the Customer you selected from From Customer.
Abbreviated name of the bank to which the customer with whom the trust relationship is being established belongs to.
Abbreviated name for the customer belonging to To Bank with whom the trust relationship is being established.

Click on the magnifying glass icon and select the user who has to be linked with the From User to establish the relationship. The List of Users popup opens and you can click on the Abbreviated Name column to select the required user. The list of users available is linked to the Customer you selected from To Customer.
Select the status of the trust relationship from the options: Active and Inactive.

Direction of flow of information once the trust relationship is established. It can be either Uni-directional and Bi-directional. Uni-directional allows the flow of information from From Company to To Company and Bi-directional allows between both companies. In other words, Uni-directional allows the From User to view account balances of To User, however, the reverse is not true. Bi-directional allows both From User and To User to view each others account balances.

section.title: Trust Relationship Company Level Form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a popup window will appear to confirm the choice.

row.entry:
Save the trust relationship.
Remember to click Submit when the changes have been made. Navigating away from the page will lose the changes, even if the OK on the sub-form(s) where the changes were made, has been clicked, and they are shown on the list within the form.

entry.para: Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.
Open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Audit Queries
section.para: As an administrator at a bank, you use the Audit Trail function to monitor actions carried out by users of Fusion Corporate Channels in your bank and/or its client companies. If you are the Bank Group administrator, you can monitor users of all the banks in your group and of their client companies. Bank administrators cannot see the activities of other banks or the Bank Group users.

This function is particularly useful to trace actions that failed authorisation, for technical issues, and for security monitoring of login attempts or jurisdiction manipulation. It is also useful for following customers' activity on Fusion Corporate Channels, and thus identifying their preferred modules and functionalities.
Click Audit Trail from the left navigation menu on the Bank Home page to access the Audit Queries options.

section.title: Audit Queries Options
section.para: The Audit Queries functions are part of the Audit Trail menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: List all login (successful or unsuccessful) and logout actions.

List all actions regarding product transactions. For example, you can use this to audit submissions that failed because of jurisdiction problems, so you can consider modifying the amounts in authorisations.
List all uses of System Features, including the Change Profile, Jurisdiction Maintenance, User Maintenance and Data Maintenance modules.

section.title: Audit Queries - Login
section.para: This option lists all login (successful or unsuccessful) and logout actions. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of login and logout actions that have taken place.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The search criteria fields are as follows:

entry.para: These two dates set the time frame for the inquiry. You can type them or click the calendar icon and select them from the popup.
Login name of the user who did the action. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from users in your company.
The Company the user belongs to

Result of the action. Select from the dropdown list: Successful when the action succeeded, Permission denied when the action failed, or Technical error for unexpected technical errors that should be investigated.
Displays the IP address of the device with which the user logged in

section.para: The list of actions that is returned has the following columns:

entry.para: The action performed by the user, Login or Logout.
Date and time of the action. The timestamp is related to the user timezone.
The Bank/Company the user belongs to
Result of the action: Successful when the action succeeded, Permission denied when the action failed, or Technical error for unexpected technical errors that should be investigated.
Displays the IP address of the device with which the user logged in

section.para: Click on the Action column to see the full details of an action.

The Download File button enables you to save the results in the PC. Click the Download File button and select one of the following options:
PDF downloads the list to the PC as PDF file.
CSV downloads the list to PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

entry.para: Product that the inquiry is to cover. Select from the dropdown list, which all the products accessible by your company. (for example, Bankers Guarantee, Bill Payment, Export Letter of Credit, etc.).

chapter.title: Data Maintenance Module
chapter.para: This module differs from the most of the modules described in this book, in that it is targeted to a slightly different type of bank administrator. It is not on the System Features menu but the Middle-Office menu. It is made available to more users than are the modules that deal with jurisdiction and the maintenance of customers, banks and users.
As an administrator at a bank, you use the Data Maintenance module to maintain various lists of data useful to your bank - details of counterparties, frequently used phrases, and so on.

These are the lists that are invoked through popup windows in the transactional modules (see the User Manual - Bank), generally by clicking a magnifying glass icon. For example, in the Export Letter of Credit module, the applicant is selected from such a list.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The Data Maintenance functions are part of the Middle-Office menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Maintain the list of available customer counterparties, that is, companies that your bank can deal with. They can be beneficiaries of Letters of Credit, Banker's Guarantees and Fund Transfers, applicants of Export Letters of Credit (importers), transportation companies for Shipping Guarantees, or drawees for Export Documentary Collections.

Maintain the list of available bank counterparties, that is, banks that your bank can deal with. They can be, for example, the optional Advising Bank for a Letter of Credit, the Issuing Bank for an Export Letter of Credit notification, or the Presenting Bank for an Export Collection.
Maintain the list of frequently used phrases. These are chunks of predefined texts that a user can include in the narrative fields that appear on many forms.

section.title: Counterparties
section.para: Maintain the list of available customer counterparties.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing customer counterparties. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity (if present), Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing customer counterparties has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the counterparty, uniquely identifying it within your company. This is used as a reference key of the record and is generally not displayed in transactions.
Name of the counterparty (most often a company name) as it appears when used in a transaction record.

section.para:
You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add button at the bottom of the list to add a counterparty.

section.title: Counterparties Form
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the counterparty. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form. The updated list becomes available to your users immediately.
The form is as follows:

entry.para: Abbreviated name for the counterparty. Maximum of 35 characters. It should be a unique string of characters that is easy to remember and will be easily recognised by all members of your company to mean the counterparty in question.
Name of the counterparty as it will appear on forms in Fusion Corporate Channels. Maximum of 35 characters.

row.entry: You can click on this tab to enter or view postal address details.

entry.para: You can enter or view the customer's postal address.

note.para: You can enter up to 5 lines of 35 characters each.

entry.para: You can enter or view the customer's postal code.

note.para: You can enter a maximum of 16 characters in this field.

row.entry: You can click on this tab to enter or view the SWIFT address details.

entry.para: You can enter or view the address of the company.

note.para: You can enter up to 3 lines of 35 characters each.

entry.para: (Optional) Name of the person who is the usual contact within the counterparty. Maximum of 35 characters.
(Optional) Phone number of the contact. Maximum of 24 characters.
(Optional) Fax number of the contact. Maximum of 24 characters.
(Optional) Telex number of the contact. Maximum of 24 characters.
(Optional) Business Entity Identifier. Maximum of 10 characters.
(Optional) Email address of the contact. Maximum of 255 characters.
(Optional) Web address (URL) of the contact. Maximum of 40 characters.

section.title: Banks
section.para: Maintain the list of available bank counterparties.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing bank counterparties. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity (if present), Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing bank counterparties has the following columns:

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the bank counterparty, uniquely identifying it within your company. This is used as a reference key of the record and is generally not displayed in transactions.
Name of the bank counterparty (most often a bank name) as it appears when used in a transaction record.

section.para:
You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add button at the bottom of the list to add a Bank.

section.title: Banks Form
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the bank counterparty. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form. The updated list becomes available to your users immediately.
The form is as follows:

entry.para: Abbreviated name for the bank counterparty. Maximum of 35 characters. It should be a unique string of characters that is easy to remember and will be easily recognised by all members of your company to mean the bank in question.
Name of the bank counterparty as it will appear on forms in Fusion Corporate Channels. Maximum of 35 characters.
Address of the bank counterparty. Up to 3 lines of 35 characters each. As for the Name, these fields will appear on forms where the party is used.
(Optional) Name of the person who is the usual contact within the counterparty. Maximum of 35 characters.
(Optional) Phone number of the contact. Maximum of 24 characters.
(Optional) Fax number of the contact. Maximum of 24 characters.
(Optional) Telex number of the contact. Maximum of 24 characters.
(Optional) SWIFT code of the bank counterparty. Maximum of 11 characters.
(Optional) Email address of the contact. Maximum of 255 characters.
(Optional) Web address (URL) of the contact. Maximum of 40 characters.

section.title: Phrases
section.para: Maintain the list of your bank's frequently used phrases.

When you select this option, you are presented with the existing list of frequently used phrases. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity (if present), Abbreviated Name and Description fields at the top of the page.
The list of frequently used phrases has the following columns:

entry.para: The identifier for the phrase. Maximum of 35 characters.
Description of the phrase. Maximum of 100 characters. Together with the abbreviated name, this will be shown in the Phrases popup window that users see.

section.para:
You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add button at the bottom of the list to add an account.

section.title: Phrases Form
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the bank counterparty. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form. The updated list becomes available to your users immediately.
The form is as follows:

entry.para: The identifier for the phrase. Maximum of 35 characters.
Description of the phrase. Maximum of 100 characters. Together with the abbreviated name, this will be shown in the Phrases popup window that users see.
Text of the phrase. Up to 30 lines of 65 characters. The Phrases popup window shows only the first 150 characters.

chapter.title: Inventory of Base Permissions
chapter.para: The following table gives the full inventory of the individual permissions required to access modules and lists, to select transactions from a list, to open the input screens and to execute the various actions available in Fusion Corporate Channels.

These individual base permissions are available to create Roles (in the Role Maintenance Module), Roles being sets of these base permissions. Since banks are also responsible for role definition and preparation for their customers, the full inventory of permissions is given, for both bank middle-office and customer features.
Whenever an authorisation is required in Fusion Corporate Channels, the corresponding base permission is checked. User interactions are categorised into different Types:

listitem.para: Menu access(M): when a specific permission is required to view the menu or submenu.
List access (L): when a specific permission is required to be presented a list (e.g.: list of pending LCs).
Screen access (S): when a specific permission is required to access the form (e.g.: LC input form).
Action (A): for push buttons (e.g.: LC input form Save button).

chapter.title: Admin and Default Roles
chapter.para: Some default roles are set up in the system when it is initially installed. They should match most of a bank's needs, and serve as sample roles.

section.title: Admin Roles
section.para: Three default roles are supplied and are automatically granted to administrators, as follows. These roles should never be deleted.

listitem.para: sy_admin_user is granted to the customer administrator when a customer is created.

In the default set-up, this role is initially granted only the right to set for himself any of the roles given by the bank administrator who created the company. As a first step, and before being able for instance to create his colleagues, this user would typically need to grant his own profile the right to create users.
sy_bank_admin_user is granted to the bank administrator when a bank is created.

The same as above apply for this user in the sense that it can initially only manipulate his own permissions. In a classical set-up this user would then receive all required permissions to create users for the bank middle office, even also customers, and to grant them permissions.
sy_bank_group_admin_user is granted to the bank group administrator when Fusion Corporate Channels is installed.

The same as above applies for his initial minimal permission. On top of the common bank administration permissions, he will typically grant himself the permission to create subsidiary banks. Note that this very specific role should not be granted to any other user.

section.title: Default Roles
section.para: Refer to the Roles topic in the Technical Administration Guide for default role definitions.

section.para: Fusion Corporate Channels is delivered with a set of roles in the system. This chapter provides details for the existing roles and also for roles that can be configured for users.
